Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Oldprop3
Reviews.Content: Whilst in the best possible location for the Colosseum, and having a modern exterior, attractive lobby and roof/pool areas, and great staff who couldn't be more helpful, this hotel is dreadfully let down by its tatty corridors and old rooms. I would say the rooms are 2* whilst the rest is an acceptable 4*. Mercure need to look at bringing this location up to scratch as the room rate is definitely better spent elsewhere - not good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good location poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnniversarySpolied Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent so close to the colloseum but that's it. The room was tiny, the shower size absurd, the sense of claistrhobia still makes me shiver. The roof terrace was closed by staff who clearly could not be bothered to staff it. They made excuses about the weather for closing it without even bothering tell guests; there was no weather problem. The wifi rarely worked. It was our twenty fifth wedding anniversary and it was spoiled by this excuse for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good for families with one child”
Reviews.Author: parsiIran
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my family for 4 nights in March 2012. It is location is perfect, just few steps from Colosseom and has a special architecture that bring a two part room which already connected that allows you to stay together as well as have separate part for your child. The breakfast was good and cleanness was O.K. Although the price is expensive for the value, however it is O.K compared to other hotels in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Mitrescu
Reviews.Content: Great location just 500 m from Colosseo, good services, friendly and helping staff.Rooms are small but not too small.Furniture old and used but the hotel will be renovated so I presume there is going to be some new furniture.Beatifull teracce with swimming pool ( obviously no swimming in March but the view was great). The weak point is breakfast : 15 Euro for not so good breakfast.No warm food, poor selection of the rest.I think it's better to have breakfast somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jonh196921
Reviews.Content: what can i say but this is a great hotel,with excellent staff,yeah ok if you want info about anything then you need to ask,but im guessing thats the same in most of the hotels in the area.had a small problem while staying there but it was quickly and effeciantly sorted by the manager,breakfast staff were great,as were the reception staff,only ever saw one chambermaid who was extremly pleasent.hotel is due to be refurbished,they could do with soundproofing the rooms and putting in new windows,other than that my overall stay was excellent an hope to go back one day.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortably central”
Reviews.Author: Strana
Reviews.Content: I had a small room with a view, it's literally a 3 minutes walk from the Colosseum, you cross the street and find yourself in the bus/tram station across from a few other hotels and bars, I can say it's not a crowded area. It's basically clean and comfortable, haven't tried their breakfast, but the room was small but practical, everything at hand and it allows you to relax after a long day of nothing but walks, you've a desk, tv, closet, place to put your cloth on and an iron...This is basically it. I don't stay at hotels for long, I leave early and return to sleep at night. I haven't faced any problems, staff was friendly and the only trouble was having to go get the internet card from the reception...

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Tina S
Reviews.Content: We have a wonderful, huge room here, with a separate sitting area which was great. I do have to stay, the carpets, and furniture needs to be updated soon. They are very old, and have stains on it. However the bed was nice and clean, and so was the bathroom, which are the most important spaces anyways. It was great location to the Colosseum, and the Metro, which was great! Breakfast was also include, so that was also a plus. The rooftop pool had an amazing view so be sure to check it out!

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: Johnmcg1
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights during the week after Christmas. The location is great. The service is not. We had two rooms for our party of four. Rooms were reserved in advance. When we arrived the person at the desk advised that only one room was available at the agreed upon rate. A second room was available but at a significantly higher rate. The person working at the desk was courteous but unwilling to make a change. We asked for the Manager and discussed with him. He was rude and dismissive and unwilling to consider any adjustment. In addition to the rate issue, we had a problem with the safe in our room. Our passports were locked in the safe and it would not open. It took a long time to get a Maintenance person out to open it and we nearly missed our train reservation. The staff did not show the sense of urgency I would expect in addressing the problem. Rome is beautiful and we had a great visit, but I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pool on roof, walk to Coliseum”
Reviews.Author: smith806
Reviews.Content: The main point about this Hotel is that you can walk to all the major attractions. There is a very nice pool on the roof with snack bar. The pool attendent follows you and watches so it is not very private though. There was a mistake with the movies you order and I was charged 50$ for movies I did not watch. The front desk clerk was very rude and said it was my mistake and charged me anyway. I had to email the manager later and he apologized and said it was a mistake and they reimbursed me. He said there was a problem with the movie system. Would not stay here again because of them charging me for their mistakes.

Reviews.Title: “Great View”
Reviews.Author: Johnny869
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is quite convenient - located close to the collesium and Forum. After a long day of travel I really appreciated being able to checkin early. The single hotel room was small but perfectly adequate. My room had a view of the collesium which was great. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Silver999
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in this hotel. We arrived a few hours before check-in but the room was ready and the check-in guy that served us friendly and efficient. The room was a bit unusual in that it had a big pillar in the room and a porthole shaped window on one side. The bed was comfortable – not too hard. The air-conditioning in the room worked well which was good as it was fairly warm when we were there. The room had a fridge which also worked well. The shower was in the bathtub. The balcony was shared with the room next door & was enclosed in glass which made it quite warm but did keep out a lot of the traffic noise. From the balcony there was a view of the Colosseum which was just down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room had enough space for a family of 3. Clean. Bathrooms were not clean like the room. Very close to many attractions. Bus stop right opposite to hotel made it easier for us to commute to other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Location, Rooms....”
Reviews.Author: TheRobertss
Reviews.Content: Great Staff, Great Location, Rooms need renovating. This hotel is very conveniently situated, obviously for the Colosseum, but also the centre of Rome and for public transport. The staff were extremely helpful and courteous, taxi's were always available in a couple of minutes. We didn't take breakfast at the hotel as 15€ each for 4 is too expensive compared to what you can get in a café 1 minute away. The worse thing about the hotel were the rooms. Clean, yes but definitely in need of serious refurbishment, especially the wood panelling which looks worn out and the carpet stains. The bathroom is far too small and for me at 6ft, I had to crouch under the fixed shower head..Room too small too. Expected better from Accor...

Reviews.Title: “coffee pb”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: good in general very welcoming personnal on arrival and departure at counter desk , very nice loby and bar, *behaviour of room cleaning staff not very convenient (stress before and after breakfast) always knocking at the door, and speaking very loud only two points too be improved: 1* the coffee at breakfast buffet should be better for italy :it must be real espresso ! 2* the shower is too small even for thin people, think of people with overweight how will they do??? hope this advice will help regards

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: rkandalam
Reviews.Content: the hotel is located at a pretty center location in Rome. There are rooms with a perfect view of the colloseum. the standard rooms are very small , prefer always superior room. The bus and metro train stations are really close. The staff has to be more helpful

Reviews.Title: “Low quality”
Reviews.Author: Filippo R Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The quality of hotels in Rome is very low despite high prices. The only god thing is the location. The shower was so small for me. I have heard many noises from the street behind. Really difficult to stay Rome.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only 2 stops away from the central station - Roma Termini station, and approx 5 mins walk to the Colosseum. I upgraded our room to the Superior room but the room is pretty average, both the air-conditioning control and heater in room didn't work. We also requested a double bed but were given 2 single beds put together. Would probably consider staying somewhere else on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Shabby Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Georgie M Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a 2 minute walk from the Colosseum so is a great location! The reception areas and the service received at check in was great but the rooms themselves were in no way 4* accommodation. The bathroom was the size of a shoe box and there was a sliding door rather than a normal door which was incredibly noisy if you wanted to go to the bathroom in the middle of the night. We are a couple but were given two single beds, but they were pushed together and to be honest there wouldn't be room to move them apart if the room was to be shared by friends. The walls and sides were old and scratched with black marks and scuffs and the whole room just came across as shabby, which was a disappointment, but fortunately we visited Rome to see the sights so we did not spend much time in the room itself.

Reviews.Title: “Colosseum in my window ..”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very well located near Colosseum. Imagine you wake up, open the window and see the famous Colosseum in your front. Even at garage you can find some ruins from the past. Front desk people friendly and efficient, breakfast pretty expensive

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us.”
Reviews.Author: Blake T
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here and it was perfect for us as we spent very little time in our rooms as we were out exploring early morning to 8pm each night. Bad - quality of the room, lift and hall ways is quite low due to its age. Cleary no renovations have been done for a longtime. Good - Price (we paid 100AUD a night and were very happy with this) Location - Perfect, walking distance to everything a tourist would want to see, we felt safe walking back to our rooms at night. Breakfast - is quite expensive however it is really good, also italiens don't do breakfast so you should eat here otherwise you will find yourself wandering the streets for a place that dosn't exist. Staff - spoke pretty good english and where quite helpfull. sayed in winter - there were no heating issues.

Reviews.Title: “recommendation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the staff is very friendly and helpful the rooms are ok teh location is perfect, near metro and bus stop it is easy to find the surroundings are quiet great advantage is the internet access via the computer in the lobby

Reviews.Title: “Good but next I'll look for another option”
Reviews.Author: hermes_br
Reviews.Content: Close to the Colosseum as advertised. Walking distance from Baths of Caracalla, Colosseum, Roman Forum and serveral other ancient attractions. If you're keen to walk, Roma downtown is closed. Staff helped me in everything I needed. Nevertheless, the room I got needs renovation and it was too small. I booked a room with Colosseum view and I got it. However, as, in these rooms, you share a balcony with your neighbor, the door to the balcony was always closed.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our room was small with a large column at the end of the bed. The taps leaked in the bathroom and the TV worked sporadically. The main restaurant was closed for dinner which meant after a long day of sight seeing, having to find somewhere to eat each evening. The breakfast provided was not kept warm and at 20 Euro per person, not good value at all. There were no tea/ coffee facilities in the room. Location is the only positive.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Its a prime area.Staffs are veru friendly.Need more awareness how the international location to be maintained.City of Rome is very important location for tourist - hotel should guide more to thier guest.I have visited severel cities of Italy but I found that Rome is best among other and Italy tourist burea may guide more for tourist as I have been experinced in China,Malyasia & Vietnam.Hope to see some changes on your chain hote.

Reviews.Title: “Not many positives”
Reviews.Author: AccorMember
Reviews.Content: I am an Accor member, so thought this would be a reasonable hotel. It is the first time I've had to insist on changing rooms, after being given one of worst room I've ever stayed. Air-conditioning was useless, safe did not work, toilet flushing was major problem, building vibrated when large trucks travelled down the street. My initial complaint was met with "definatly no other rooms" available, but we can give you a fan. The fan was just too noisy & it was cooler to keep the hotel room door open. I eventually was prepared to leave the hotel, but then miraculously another room came available. Not much better, but it was cooler. Next day I bumped into a woman on her way down to complain about the air-conditioning in her room...guess what it was our old room; they simply gave it to another unsuspecting traveller. Met severla other travellers during our stay who alos were wearing a path back & forward to the complaints desk. Simply very poor customer service, ACCOR should be ashamed & sort this place out.

Reviews.Title: “Not recomended”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: In past few years i had very good expirience with hotels of this franchise so when me and my wife decided to visit Rome Mercure was our first choice.The only good thing about this hotel is the location,about 200 m away from Colloseum.Everything else is poor - it is simple not 4 star hotel.The room was small with a pillar (?) in the center of the room.Carpet was full of stains,heating device was not working properly.It is just not a 4 star hotel for which you pay 4 star fee!

Reviews.Title: “Good For City Break”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan G
Reviews.Content: I have recently stayed at this Hotel, the design is quite modern in reception and in the bar area, the rooms are not as modern and are slightly dated. The rooms are of an average size and not the biggest room Ive ever had but was ok for the 5 days that I was there. The reception staff are excellent and speak good English which is always a plus and from the one day that I had the breakfast, there were a variety of things available hot and cold.I had the pleasure of venturing up to the top floor of the hotel where there is a swimming pool and a bar, this provides great views of the Colosseum and could be a slightly different experience when these features are open in summer.

Reviews.Title: “Very central place”
Reviews.Author: Nad4
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a single room. I had the Colosseum view. The room was tiny, probably around 2.4m X 4m. Bathroom was small, and the shower screen/enclosure was around 0.6m x 0.6m. Please do not quote me on the size here. This is what I remember. However, the place is around 300m to Colosseum. The Basilica of San Clemente Rome is just in front of the hotel. Both metro line A(Manzoni station) and line B (Colosseum station) are within 10 minutes walk. Staff are friendly and helpful. Two bottles of water (one normal and one mineral) are provided inside the bar fridge in the room for free, but some days it was forgotten by the room attendant. There are good restaurants around here. Isidor on 59 Via di San Giovanni was one of the reasonable restaurent. I enjoyed the stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Accor - Rating 1 if lucky”
Reviews.Author: Robyn J
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the worst I have stayed in. The simple fact that we were not supplied with what was advertised and what was agreed to in the emails. No restaurant, no mini bar at all, the view to her Colosseum was from the second floor along a major road (so much for views from what was to be their best room?) or so I was informed via email when I enquired and paid for in advance. The breakfast, very ordinary, and T bags were gold if you could get some. An airconditoning unit that did not work, a very ordinary TV and the only place for luggage was on the bed or in one tiny corner. No where to sit I have travelled a fair amount and could definitely say that this hotel is the worst, because of misleading emails, and the lack of helpful staff. Even had an email from the hotel that confirmed our Limousine transfer to the Cruise terminal only to find out that they had nothing on record and nothing had been booked? Explain that one! I gave it 1 star only because of the position being close to the archeological sites. Have been to Rome before and if this had been my first time,because of the attitude of this hotel I would probably never go again thinking that this was the norm. Beleive me it is not. Just stay elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “My hotel review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Mecure hotel. The thing we liked most about this hotel was its location as it was only a short walk from the termini and directly across from the coloseum. This made it very easy for us to travel around to see all the sights and we got so much done in our short stay. The hotel was clean and the staff were friendly and very helpful to us. We liked the option we got prior to our arrival to have a room with a view of the coloseum.The only thing that dissappointed us was we were unable to see the roof pool and get the view from there.

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel with good service”
Reviews.Author: RoyRI
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located within easy walking distance from the Colloseum as well as a somewhat longer but interesting walk from the main city centre (Via del Corso). The breakfast was good and the staff very prompt in service. The room was a bit disappointing with a pillar in the middle of it!

Reviews.Title: “You'll net get a good service unless you look upper class”
Reviews.Author: ekb10148
Reviews.Content: Hotel location was perfect, however that was all that was impressive about it. As soon as I and my partner arrived we were sneered at and were asked if we were sure we were in the correct hotel (I am 18, my partner is 21) The staff were unhelpful and rude, after we checked in I went down to ask a question and I was shooed away by the staff who said they were busy, despite the fact there was no one else being checked in or seen to at the time. The pool isn't really a pool, more a large bath about 3mx6m and the sun loungers are few and far between, when I walked past the reception later I saw a family with young kids asking if they had any more sun loungers and they too were sneered away. I know this hotel claims it has business facilities but it's hardly fun to be ignored on your holiday because you aren't business class and you aren't paying 24euors (yes 24 euros) for a full breakfast every morning. I think if you don't need a pool for your holiday, book somewhere else, there are other hotels just as central as this one and with far nicer staff (we had lunch in one of the other hotels where the staff weren't put off by our age as they understood we were in Rome to buy what we required for the holiday)

Reviews.Title: “A recommander!”
Reviews.Author: sjelleke Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mercure Collosea with 3 adults and 2 teenagers (2 rooms). The room for 3 was large and comfortable. The room for 2 was smaller but still comfortable. As offer from the hotel, we received free bus tickets and also a filled minibar (water) for free. The breakfast was tasty with a lot of different things to choose but I think that the breakfast room is a little too small in comparison to the amount of rooms in the hotel. We had to wait twice for a free table but nevertheless, the service remained friendly and helpful. During our stay, the weather was very nice which resulted in a "warmer" room which we wanted to air. The airconditioning wasn't properly working (anymore because of the season?) and opening a window didn't help much either. But this is a personal experience and nothing to be negative about. If we ever visit Rome again, we will surely go back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not enough quality for a Mercure hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well located and easy to reach from Airport or train station. However the hotel had many issues: room was not clean, super strong and bad odor, bathroom small and old, super noisy and uncomfortable mattress. People in main desk were useless and unfriendly. I think this hotel should be a 1 star hotel rather than a 4 * hotel. If you only care about the location, is a good place. Otherwise you´d better look for a better one.

Reviews.Title: “great view of colosseum”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: small comfortable rooms with a great view. However pillows were to big so all of us had troubles with slip. otherwise best location with a best service. Breakfast is extra 15 euro per person. would recommend to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “stolen handbag”
Reviews.Author: neal155
Reviews.Content: sunday 23 oct 2011.whilst eating breakfast my handbag was stolen while sitting eating .we alerted the waiting staff and their response was not very helpful .we then reported this to reception ,who did not seem suprised .next morning we spoke to the duty manager who seemed very concerned and are now awaiting a reply from the mercure group.

Reviews.Title: “really good value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location Close to Hop On Hop Off stop. Very friendly staff and fantastic pool and bar on roof top. Plenty of eating places near by and supermarket for cheap alcoholand nibbles.Colleseum very close but be wary of gypsies

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The strinking point of this hotel is its very convenient location. If you go to Rome in vacancy you will not be too much interested to stay inside the hotel, so, in this sense, this hotel fulfill very well the needs to have a clean place to sleep and to take a shower. My main criticism concerns to the broken air conditioned and the absence of curtains in the bathroom windows, which allows people from outside to see you taking a shower. It is also worthwhile to mention that the staff of the hotel is very kind and that there is a free wireless connection.

Reviews.Title: “Ok - after initial mess of our booking!”
Reviews.Author: Chloe M
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for us as the final part of our honeymoon through Virgin Cruises. We had a booking voucher from Virgin to give to the hotel which we produced on arrival. On arrival we were told that there was no booking for us! We were then told that they needed to contact Virgin to confirm a booking existed. An hour later we were still being told that they had no response from Virgin. This time I took matters into my own hands and called Virgin myself. I was told by Virgin that there was no problem and as far as they were concerned we were booked in and they were talking to the hotel, which was odd considering the hotel were still saying they had no contact from Virgin. In the end we were finally given a room and told that there was no problem. It was a disappointing end to our honeymoon and a sorry start to our two days in Rome. If the room was available and there was no problem I don’t know why we were left in the lobby thinking we had no where to stay for an hour. Putting this initial issue aside we found the staff at the hotel friendly and helpful with any questions we asked. The room was clean but had a musty smell so we kept the window open. The safe would not work even after we had asked at reception. The roof top bar is lovely and service is good, if you intend to use it in the evening make sure you get in the right lift as only one of them goes to the roof top after a certain time. We only found this out from another couple a day too late! The pool is very clean and towels are provided for use at the poolside. Breakfast was very simple but nice with a good choice of juices, breads and cereal as well as scramble eggs and frankfurter sausages if you like a hot breakfast. Again the area was lovely and clean and we found the staff attentive. It was great being so close to the Colosseum which is in easy walking distance and we would recommend the Roma hop on hop off bus tour which took us everywhere we needed to see in a short period of time. If we were to go back to Rome I think we would look at staying in a busy part of the city with more atmosphere as it seemed more friendly and welcoming but for a day or two this hotel is reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Rome Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A good hotel. Staff and service was very good. Rooms were dated and in need of refurbishment. Location was good. Beds lovely and comfortable and the linen was good. Lovely pool and bar on the roof top which was a great way to relax at the end of the day Would be happy to stay again and would be happy to recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Central Rome”
Reviews.Author: Peggysue43
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a greaat location, we found it very eary to get to all the attractions from here, the nearby restaurants all good, Hop on/off bus within walking distance. Rooftop pool is another great, breakfast good, rooms were far too small for a four day stay and the showers smaller still, for a mature couple. The staff all friendly and patient. It is a great idea to pre book any attractions, this avoids having to line up, in most cases pre booked tickets go straight to the priority line. We travelled with another mataure couple

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Chris906
Reviews.Content: Waking up each morning with the view of the Colosseum was a bonus. The hotel is within walking distance of most of Rome's main attractions and close to the Metro lines for those further away. A problem with a noisy door and settings on the air con were sorted immediately. The rooftop bar was a great place to relax after a day out. Breakfast was excellent as was the service throughout the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, smallest shower”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location but the rooms are very small and the shower very small indeed. If you are tall and large and intend spending a lot of time in your room then this hotel is not for you. However for smaller people that only spend a little time in the room then this is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: MMcLiverpool
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location a five minute stroll to the Colliseum. We stayed in a premier room which looked out to the Colliseum. The roof top pool and bar are very good with lovely views across the city and a nice area to sit after sightseeing around the city. The local buses stop a few yards from the hotel entrance and the city tour buses stop close to the Colliseum. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The bathrooms are very compact, but you don't spend your holiday in the bathroom so this is no major problem. The breakfast is good with hot food, cereals, fruit and pastries available, they also provide gluten free food on request. Via Labricana is a busy road and you can hear the traffic at night, but you are in a city so this is to be expected. The staff were friendly and helpful. Overall a pleasant stay and I would not hesitate to return for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice place”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Close to the Coliseum and other Rome monuments. Easy access to tour buses and a metro station. I have particular enjoyed the rooftop bar. The breakfast restaurant was very good and I did not miss a single breakfast during my seven mornings at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: Natalia F
Reviews.Content: Ok its no Ritz but WHO CARES!! Not only the only hotel in rome (center) with a pool but the view is out of this world! The pool is on the roof facing the collosseum, your could almost touch it! It was no Hilton but im not fussy, It was clean , the staff were friendly, The roof top bar was a good laugh every night and it was a walk away from every tourest attraction. The beds are very uncomfertable, i couldnt do more than 4-5 days here but they are referbing next year. The American Breakfast is DISCUSTING and over priced. Sara and the ukrain bar tender really made our holiday. FAB hotel,

Reviews.Title: “Delta Colosseo not living up to the cost”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Mercure Roma Delta Colosseo, the location was in top and the service people was very nice and helpful, specially the lady at the top floor bar. However, the rooms are worn down but clean. Specially the aircon was not working properly and with nights at 33 degree we had almost no sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Rooftop terrace on Colosseum outweighs substandard property”
Reviews.Author: Deborah M
Reviews.Content: First of all, I really like the Mercure Hotel chain and I always look for their properties when I travel. This hotel was not up to the usual Mercure standard but it hasn't been in their group that long as far as I know since when I lived in Rome, this hotel was just plain Delta Colosseo. The location is just as fabulous as advertised, although the hotel is in a rather worn and tired condition overall. The staff was a weird mix of extremely kind and helpful and breathtakingly rude. One of the maids whom I encountered in the elevator as I was trying to make it to the pool before closing (pool hours are 11 a.m.-8 p.m.) actually told me, after telling me to "calm down" (I was hurrying) that "the pool guy might do me the favor of letting me take a swim". This at 7:40 p.m. when the pool was still officially open so not really a favor. But the pool guy was super nice, as was the evening bartender. Unfortunately there was some weird "event" going on the evening I was there in which a bunch of people got dressed up in polyester "Roman Empire" costumes. There was some New Agey music to accompany the event which struggled for dominance with the ambient music coming over the loudspeakers. My single room was minuscule and noisy since the rooms are definitely not soundproofed in any way. Bottom line, this is a 2-star hotel with 3-star prices in a 5-star location. If you want something really really nice, try the Gladiatori down the street. But if you do decide to stay here (and the prices really are not bad), my advice is to call ahead and find out about any events that might be going on etc., because I had this whole fantasy of spending the evening on the terrace with a glass of wine gazing out over ancient Rome and instead, as a non-participant in the Event, I got relegated to the back corner of the terrace with a view out over apartment buildings with some kind of Peruvian mouth harp music in one ear and Seal in the other.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally Located”
Reviews.Author: Notellu
Reviews.Content: I stayed a this holey for 4 nights (booked via Accor club) and found the hotel well located in Rome with a 10 minute walk to the Colosseum where you will find a stopping point for the Hop on Hop off bus points (run by different company's). The staff at the hotel and very helpful and willing to assist you in any way they can. There is a pool in the roof with a garden bar as well. The room that I stayed in was old but it appears that they are slowly refurbishing the hotel (perhaps in the off season), but the air conditioning in my room was not the best and seemed to work best when night came. The hotel is situated close to a main road (noticed it more with the ambulance going past every 20 minutes or so). They do provide a continental breakfast and if you do not have it included in the room price it will cost you $15 EUR per person and cheaper if you have it in the garden bar on the roof. Internet is available from the front desk and is free (for me anyway) through the hotel.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington DC, District of Columbia, USA
Reviews.Title: “Great location, horrid A/C, and reservation/billing craziness”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I booked a great pre-paid rate in April 2011 for September 2011 stay. The hotel didn't bother to charge my card until the day before my arrival and my card had expired and I had a new number. The hotel emailed me that my reservation was in jeopardy while I was trying to explore Pompeii. So after multiple emails, international cell calls, etc, we got it worked out, but I was livid that the hotel didn't follow through on their pre-paid, pay in full in advance system, caused me much anxiety that our reservation would be canceled during Rome's busy season, and spent way too much money on calls -- and I had purposely booked 6 months in advance to avoid any worry or hassle. We complained and the hotel said they're now charging cards when people book a pre-paid room.... why did it take my complaint to get this to happen?!? Once we arrived our A/C barely cooled the room from the 85 degrees outside -- it was too hot to sleep well. We complained and were told the hotel is working on renovations. Perhaps stay in the Spring or Fall when temperatures are cooler since the A/C is seriously underwhelming. The location of the hotel is fantastic and the roof top bar & pool overlook the Colosseum and entire city. Check it out at sunset!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jamie M
Reviews.Content: Great location for hotel, with an amazing view overlooking the colosseum, especially from their rooftop bar and pool. Rooms were quite average and small. But if you are on holiday and out and about during the day then not really a problem. Restaurants around the area are quite lovely, and staff service is great.

Reviews.Title: “Location and roof top patio great but dirty and unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: HowardJfan
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay here but we won't do a 3rd. Fantastic location near Forum etc and rooftop patio is fantastic after a long day. But... Hotel rooms are realy dirty and carpets discusting. Staff very unfriendly and un cooperative. Air conditioning doesn't work and front desk set up a fan to keep themselves cool. Gotten worse sice first time - suggest you look for other locations in area for a better overall stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not really up for Accor standards...”
Reviews.Author: GIANCARLOSILVESTRI
Reviews.Content: Second time i stay at this hotel because of its location. Very high potential but the hotel is very bad maintained, rooms are filthy, A/C didn't worked ( the first time I stayed there a year ago was the same). Service was pretty good, italians we are very friendly and customer oriented but the bottom line is that this hotel should close and get a serious renovation or Accor please retire your brand name from this property because its just a mess for your quality brand known worldwide...not even for a Motel 6 standard.

Reviews.Title: “Desperately in need of a revamp - so much potential”
Reviews.Author: bombayelectric
Reviews.Content: It such a shame because this hotel has the potential to be really great. It has a great location and a fantastic rooftop bar with an unbeatable view of the Colosseum; just sublime at sunset. The staff are really friendly and professional. Where this hotel really dissapoints is in the rooms themselves, we were a family of 8 travelling together so we had four rooms to compare, all had some rather frightening stains on the carpet and furniture and marks on the walls, making the room look and feel really dirty. I hope they can get these minor cosmetic issues repaired because then it will be a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “holiday in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, right next to colosseum, great location, a bit expensive , but then so was everything in Rome. Would expect free wifi in room at this price and breakfast could have been a bit better for the price. aircon is essential in Summer in Rome and although it worked, it was a little bit weak and could be improved.

Reviews.Title: “Great location , badly needs refurbishment.”
Reviews.Author: GrazSydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night following a month in Italy holidaying in various locations, we just wanted a stopover hotel to meet our airline connections so for one night had no great expectations. We had most of one day to explore Rome which we did successfully via one of the " hop on " buses which stop at theColloseum about a 400 meter walk from the hotel. We found the hotel badly needs refurbishing with stained and well worn carpets, dings and scratches on the walls and furniture, ineffective air conditioner, room size ( like many other European ) rather small, and the weird presence of a concrete column in the room was to say the least. We had a light lunch at the rooftop bar which suited our timing but the service was very slow and the lady serving just did not want to be there. There was a pool on the terrace it was waist high and basic but for kids or a quick cool off it was ok. To be positive the Terrace did offer a great view of the Colleseum and nearby areas and the park. Our room also offered good views though it appeared a lot of rooms had no outlook. We had just the one breakfast and it was adequate, we had no problem with queing as we were leaving early. One review I recently read stated you could walk to most of the main sites in Rome from the hotel, we do a lot of walking but I think that statement is super optimistic. It is interesting how reviews of one place can vary so much from different people, so much depends on your expectations and comparisons, we would not return to this hotel, whilst recognizing this is Rome, we thought it was overpriced shabby and not good value. Graz Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother staying here.”
Reviews.Author: bigdctraveler
Reviews.Content: This is the most horrible experience I have ever had at a hotel. This was to be a 4 star hotel and at best it was a 2 star hotel. We stayed at this hotel under recommendation of our cruise line and they are also receiving a copy of what happened here. The photos only show updated areas of the hotel which is very misleading. We had an air condition unit in our room that ran, but had NO COLD AIR COMING FROM IT. When they pulled the cover off to let the air CIRCULATE BETTER, it was covered with black mold. We complained every day we were there with no response other than that the units are running. They finally gave us a small box fan on the 2nd day. The carpet was filthy and stained, I never walked on it barefoot. There were holes in the carpeting near the bathroom. The bathroom was remodeled and looked nice, but was not very clean. The whole decor of the hotel in the non renovated areas was horrible and looked like it was from the 80's. We would have left, but we were traveling with 3 other couples and had arranged transports already to and from here. Two other couples had no air also and the couple did have have air, just like the hall way and the check in area and dining areas. It was greatly over priced along with the breakfast options. I will never stay in any of their properties on any future travel.

Reviews.Title: “PLEASE don't stay here unless you like living in a HOT Dirty MESS”
Reviews.Author: zoozay
Reviews.Content: This is NOT a 4 star hotel as they list on their website. The photos on the Accor Hotel site of this Hotel are photos of a "Pig with Lipstick on it". At NO time did the A/C work and the A/C unit was completely loaded with black mold. The room was filthy and I mean dirty! The carpet has huge dark black rings of dirt and looks as though there is never an attempt to even keep it clean or fresh! The front desk staff with the exception on one nice gentleman on the night shift was so completely non caring! To the point that they would just tell you anything just to get you to leave them alone. This hotel could be stellar with a fresh start.....but it is just abysmal! PLEASE take along your cleaning products and a fan to stay cool if you decide to stay here. I paid $826 for three nights!!! Where is Tom Bodett when you need him!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Great service.....”
Reviews.Author: Otagopete
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend in Roma.... Booked the hotel direct on the internet... Booked a single room.... at a great price. Arrived in Rome late .... to late for the Metro... took a cab to hotel... Check in was great and the service was impressive... The hotel gave a free Metro pass for 1 day... which was great.. Breakfast was great the staff very helpful. The big plus for this hotel is it location... close to the coliseum and Metro station. The roof top bar and swimming pool was great for the hot day to relax in. The room was average will only news channel in English... however the internet was free.. It was an okay size for a single room... and well appointed I would come back here... Thank you for a stay....

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: OlyaKotik
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very good location near the Colosseo. Besides it has a small swimming-pool on the rooftop, where you can enjoy the view of Rome as well. It's really a very cool option! The personnel is very helpful! What I didn't like is that the room was small, and it was difficult with the Internet, the wifi and computer service were expensive and my iPad didn't recognize wifi. Still all the rest I liked a lot. The breakfast is not cheap, but very good! I would recommend this hotel to those who come to see the city!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Gay District”
Reviews.Author: happywhenitravel
Reviews.Content: Traveled solo to Rome for a pre-Atlantis (gay) cruise stay. Hotel was recommended by Atlantis, probably due to it's proximity to the "gay" street. Was nice to be within walking distance to the local gay bars and ancient Rome. Walked from Termini to this station which with bags was a little too far, definitely consider taking a cab or the metro to the Colosseo stop (no elevator). Single room was small, but appointed nicely. Shower was VERY small, smaller than the shower on my cruise ship. As a tall guy it was difficult to be comfortable in the shower. Sparkling and Still water provided each day in the refrigerator. All in all a great value for what I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: Mbett1
Reviews.Content: I should have believed the reviews on this site. The room was the size of a postage stamp, the furniture was poor quality, the shower was tiny and the carpet was filthy both in the corridor and the room. However the bed was comfortable. The airconditioning did not work. This was a business trip, the hotel bills itself as a 'business friendly hotel', there was no wifi or internet connection in the bedroom - they were using a hard wire connection in the lobby - hardly ideal for business users.. Mercure ought to be thoroughly ashamed of this product - and I write as an A- club Platinum member who has been loyal to the Accor brand.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - Shocking Room”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Lobby, Restaurant, Breakfast and general service was great . The rooms was very disapointing Hot water pressure was non existant - we struggled to shower with any hot water. Mentioned to reception but no response was received. Complained three times that the safe in the room was chirping and needed the battery replaced .. didnt happen in 4 days. Had to stuff a pillow over the safe so I couldnt hear it. 4 weeks in europe - worst room of my trip

Reviews.Title: “Would Recommend”
Reviews.Author: dpsbeechy
Reviews.Content: Whilst looking through hotels in Rome we had 3 stipulations - all of which I will focus my review on: 1: Good location. 2: Swimming pool. 3: Good quality rooms. The Mercure Roma Delta Colosseo delivered on all accounts. The location was perfect. Close enough so that virtually all of the main attractions in Rome were walk-able and just out of the away enough that upon leaving the hotel you're not 'thrown into the action' immediately. If you have seen any pictures of the hotel you will see that the swimming pool is fairly small and barely reaches the waist area. Clearly this does not allow for swimming as an exercise form however for a quick dip to relieve the heat of the sun this is perfect. The roof top bar / area is out of this world. The panoramic views of Roma are breathtaking and there are many 'local' views to be admired such as the park next door, the church opposite and old ladies watering their plants on their terraces. There is an array of seating ranging from double 'lounging' seats to high table seating. I would suggest the only downside is the somewhat expensive drinks / food menu available. Our 'Superior' room was fairly compact although not cramped. The view from our room (306) looked straight upon the Colosseum and the 'balcony' provided a nice atmosphere. The maids were very good in that the beds were perfectly made, the mineral water was replenished free of charge daily and the towels/toilet roll/soap was also replenished when needed. The bed itself was also extremely comfortable although the pillows were rather large! On the whole I would suggest that the rooms could do with a general update i.e. paint / decoration / carpet etc. The staff on the roof terrace / bar were friendly, helpful and very welcoming. Although I do feel the reception staff downstairs could do with following their lead! If I were to return to Roma I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: RKieling
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights and loved it. Friendly and helpful staff, great roof top (pool, bar, amazing view), decent rooms, good location. The only drawback was that there was no wi-fi in the room (only a cable connection in the lobby).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great roof top but awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: eireann12
Reviews.Content: Location was excellent- Just a short walk to the Colosseum and great view from the top of the hotel. The best parts of the hotel were the lobby and the roof top other than that the room was small and smelly. Our room and family's room had an intrusive big pole in the room at the end of the bed. The hallways stank and there were layers of dust on the carpet on the sides of stairs. Was happy to leave the hotel. The staff were nice though. Check in process was slow. i give it 2 stars for the roof top but it didn't make up for the rest of the hotel. Would not stay in the hotel again not unless i could sleep on the sofa on the roof : )

Reviews.Title: “TOTALLY A DISSAPOINTMENT”
Reviews.Author: ozzfurkan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Mercure Delta Colosseo after our honeymoon in Capovaticano, for one night. As we were booking, we were amazed with the pictures of the hotel on its website, and paid extra money for the Colosseum view deluxe room. The hotel looks ok from the outside and the lobby, but when you go upstairs, you face the reality! the rooms are extra small and a bad odour of dust makes it hard to breathe. The aircondition does not work and the windows are too small and high to see the view (!) of Colosseum. The view is only you can see a very tiny part of the historical building at a large distance! The pool on the roof seems wonderful at the hotel pictures, but the reality is again a disaster. A very small strange pool on the roof did not attract us at all. Taxi costs 10 euros to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay here!”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller909
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and had a pleasant stay here. The fact that they have a pool is such a major plus!! Our room was very large compared to others that we saw walking through the hallways occasionally. It had a shared enclosed balcony which was nice. The only complaint is that I wish they had a cheaper breakfast. We never ate breakfast at the hotel, instead we went to a local supermarket and bought our own foods. A great money saving tip! Overall, I enjoyed my stay here. It was so close to the Colosseum and metro which can take you all over Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Good bargain”
Reviews.Author: Annickvo Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Although we had a small room with a tiny shower you could hardly move in, this was a good bargain. We booked months in advance and had a special rate far below the normal room rate. Location is fantastic, literally 5 min. walk from the Colloseum. Plenty of nice restaurants in the neighbourhood in little side streets, away from the tourist trap resto´s near the Colloseum.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Felicitycogan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 7 nights last week, and did not have one problem with it. I read a couple of reviews before going which werent great but in my opinion if i go back to rome i will stay there. The staff were so friendly and nothing was too much trouble. The location is great i walked everywhere and it generally took 30 min to walk to Termini or to walk to the river. I wouldnt recommend the hop on hop off bus tho as i found it took atleast 2 hours to do and sometimes they went back to places instead of doing a full circuit. If you have a map its pretty easy to work out where to go.

Reviews.Title: “convenient for coliseum, and local restaurants”
Reviews.Author: raykaypoole Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location is quite nice out of the bustle of Rome. Within two streets across the road are a number of reasonable restaurants. The Room was a superior room, however , it was very bijou. One bar was not open but the roof bar was very pleasant. The roof top pool was great to cool off, but not good for a swim. We would stay again for its relatively quiet location.

Reviews.Title: “The Italian 'Faulty Towers'”
Reviews.Author: wowsmiley
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and expected problems, here goes....... 4 night stay- 3 rooms! 1st night, no air con- given a fan. Room 104 the aircon hasn't worked in years avoid. 2nd night- nice junior suite, toilet broke prior to 3rd sleep. 3rd and 4th night good room, tiny shower cubicle, intermittent tv and lights- compensated for the room swaps with 2x free breakfasts each and 4 bar drinks. Having stayed at Mercure hotels in NZ, this hotel is very disappointing and not up to the 4*rating. Other negatives- bar drinks prices, frozen food only (microwaved pizza is the basic snack menu) and 15 euro breakfast!!- over priced and basic. Positives- excellent staff, english speaking. 2 min walk to Colloseum and some lovely local restaurants, cafes, ice cream shops. Under 5 minute walk to tourist bus stop and Metro. Pool and bar area clean and pleasant. Overall I would not stay here again if I stayed in Rome, however if you want a central hotel with a pool- this is it, don't think there are many others!!

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EVER STAYED IN!!”
Reviews.Author: CosANDLou
Reviews.Content: This was me and my fiancee's first trip to Rome and was certainly not impressed by the hotel at all! After being ripped off by a cab that charged 80 EURO, when we later learned that there was a flat either to and from the airport of 40 EURO, upon arrival of the hotel we had to wait 2 and a half hours for our room as it was not ready for us. After an early morning flight, the last thing you want is to be waiting around for your room to be ready! What made it worst is we received no apology or empathy from the staff, they did not accommodate one bit! On other occasions where we needed assistance from the hotel, we were given poor service. The only good service we received was from the waitress who worked at the bar on the top deck floor near the pool - she was very polite and gave great customer service. The room was dirty and small and the TV often did not work. And everyday we had problems with our key card for our door thus making many trips from the front desk which was an utter annoyance. The location was good and it was near to the Metro and bus line services. We hope to return back to Rome one day but we certainly won't be returning to the Mercure Delta Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps the worst hotel I stayed at throughout my trip in Europe.”
Reviews.Author: Nelson168
Reviews.Content: The Mercure Roma Delta Colosseo looks great on paper in terms of location to the Colosseo and also the Metro. However, our experience beyond that was terrible. Upon checking into our tiny room, we found broken stuff all over the bathroom floor with dirt. The drop ceiling in the bathroom also was hanging loose and the couple times we opened and closed the door it made a loud noise and seemed on the verge of collapsing. The front desk did immediately switch us to another room. However, earlier while checking in, we were told that the hotel was completely full. The 2nd room was no better. Once we rolled in with our belongings, we went straight to the bathroom to inspect it. Immediately we noticed there was no toilet paper and the trash bin was never emptied. It was filled with the trash from the previous guests. Also, the bed did not have any bed sheets as a comforter. We had to ask for it from the front desk. The room was extremely hot and suffocating because the air was turned off. We left one of the door keys in the slot so the electricity would stay on while we went out and dined. When we came back the room was pretty much the same temperature. Around 80 degrees! It was unbearable. The front desk said that we just had to leave it on for a while because it was a hot day earlier. We had left it on for 2 hours straight. Any normal, functioning A/C would have cooled a small room no matter how hot the day was. We were also told that since we were on the top floor the sun probably heated our room much more than the lower floors. Excuses do not cut it. Bottom line, the room stayed at around 80 degrees day and night with no circulation for our entire stay. This is unacceptable to any guest. If you need WIFI service, forget it. Make sure to bring your laptop and they will provide you with a complimentary cable connection. Otherwise, you will have to use their slow computer that charges you 35 cents Euro per minute. The pool on the rooftop is a joke. Nice to have to cool down in the summer heat, but it is really an enlarged kiddy pool. Also, be aware of using the pool towels. We saw a staff member hanging wet pool towels to air dry on the roof. Many of them were only partially wet leading us to believe whether they were just being air dried to be reused. So to be safe, bring your towels with you from your room. My suggestion, do not stay in this hotel unless heat and lack of cleanliness do not bother you.

Reviews.Title: “An awful hotel in a top location”
Reviews.Author: Ozaqua
Reviews.Content: Wifi advertised but not available. Room air-conditioning not working. Rooms small and dated. Carpets appear to have not been vacuumed in months. Service bratty during day and non existent at night. They claim to be four star but I've seen better rooms in a backpackers.

Reviews.Title: “I will definitely be back!!”
Reviews.Author: Josephine01Sydney
Reviews.Content: I noticed some bad reviews for this hotel so thought I would add some positive points for those considering staying here. I have just returned home after 4 weeks holidaying in Europe and the United Arab Emirates staying at Accor properties. We stayed at Sofitel's and in Italy M Gallery's but in Rome we ended up staying at this Mecure. I was not expecting much prior to arrival but I can honestly say we were very pleasantly surprised! The location is fantastic and the rooftop pool and bar are even more fantastic. We started each day with a coffee on the rooftop and a swim and ended each day there with a swim and a glass of wine after busy days sightseeing and shopping. They have a great winelist showcasing many great Italian wines at very affordable prices and served in gorgeous glasses. We stayed for three nights here and I can honestly say I did not want to leave. The hotel I understand is going through a refit and so I think we were extremely fortunate and received a room that has been refitted. I must say when booking online we opted to pay a little extra for an upgrade and it was well worth it. The room was on the top floor with windows that opened out to look directly at the colosseum- magical! It had fairly new furniture and a flat screen tv etc. If you are thinking about staying here pay the extra and take this option, although I am sure very soon the whole hotel will be upgraded. As for the staff, some did seem a little unfriendly but the female Duty manager on the day we arrived was wonderful, lovely and very helpful as were all the rooftop staff. My partner and I loved staying here and can not wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location, loved the pool, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: sandi_ellon
Reviews.Content: Good location, huge family room (almost like a suite) with two tv's. One remote not working - filled in maintenence card, hung it on door, fixed by later in the day. Desk staff very pleasant. Good ice-cream shop across the road. Lots of fairly cheap cafe/ restaurants a couple of streets away. No little shops around. Free mineral water in the room but only replenished once during our 4 night stay. Very handily placed for Colosseo Metro station. About 15 mins walk to Termini station. Bar prices excessive. Great views from rooftop pool.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: 3 C,s to start with. Comfortable, clean and close by to places of interest and dining . Rooms were a bit small but comfortable with good bedding. Air conditioning in good working order! Roof top bar with an excellent view and refreshing air. Carpet needs some attention but you forget that after a few hours. Staff have a good command of Englsih and they were delightful and helpful. Staff can arrange tours if you ask them. They give clear directions and quite resourceful. In Rome, you need their help! Walking distance to a number of monuments and sites and squares. A nice park just beside the hotel if you want to have a quiet moment. On the whole, it has been an enjoyable stay with verynlittle stressnatbthisnhotel.Good value! We encountered no problem staying at this hotel. We were glad we stayed there instead of hotels nearer to train station. Walking distance to a number of interesting monuments and sites not to mention the great Colosseum.! There is a nice park just beside the hotel for a quiet moment if you want. All in all, it was enjoyable with Minimum stress at the hotel. Definitely good value! stayednthereninsteadnofmsomewhere nearer to train station.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but hotel really needs a makeover”
Reviews.Author: jtwiz
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel because my company had a very good corporate negotiated rate and of course, the great location. I read the reviews on TA, and thought, how bad can it be? Well, here's what I can tell you...the good: it is a super location. Walking distance to most, if not all, major tourist sites in Rome. The rooftop bar and pool area is very nice, with a spectacular view. The staff at the hotel are knowledgeable, friendly and extremely competent. My room was very clean, especially the bathroom. Small, but new flat screen TV with about 5 English language stations. The bad: The rooms are tiny. Think London size, but actually smaller. None of the other reviewers were exaggerating about how miniscule the shower is. I seriously do not think my average-size husband would fit in it. As a single female traveler, I would have preferred a hotel with a restaurant so I could either get room service or dine within the hotel at dinner time (but I knew this was not available when I made the reservation.) The ugly: Wow, the hallways of the hotel had a serious musty odor and were downright dirty. Stained carpets and beat-up looking walls. While my room was certainly clean, the carpet had permanent stains and the furniture just looked worn out. The bottom line is that this hotel needs a serious refurbishment. With such a great location and amenities like the rooftop pool and bar, it could be a wonderful property. But until the rooms and hallways are given a makeover, I cannot recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Poor old rooms No Air condition Bad service, 2 old elevators that stop working often. i am an accore loyal customer , I have been always a fan of mercure, but this hotel is so bad in every aspect , that i would like to warn everyone to stay away

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: topgun24fan
Reviews.Content: Not sure why others are knocking this place, I thought it was fantastic! Great location, the Colosseium is right down the road, great shops and cafes just a short walk away. The rooftop pool and bar was great as well. Room was clean and comfortable. The Breakfast was also great, best scrambled eggs I have ever had! I would stay there again in a second!

Reviews.Title: “worst stay of our trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Accor should get rid of this hotel and the staff.we have spent over 20 nights in the accor brand hotels,this was the worst experience.we arrived at 10am,staff informed us hotel room ready at 2pm,so we returned only to be told room ready soon,finally at 4.45pm we were able to get into our room.breakfast!we had to set our own tableafter staff pointed to a table which was not cleaned down , we cleared table and put plates on another table and set our own. staff were only interested if you spoke italian,only in italy did we notice this.terrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Irma77
Reviews.Content: The room was really small, the shower ridicously tiny the air conditioning very noisy and not very effective. Breackfast expensive and very poor quality, don't take it, doesn't worth it! Every time we passed by the front-desk the receptionists were having some sort of argument with costumers. Actually we had a bad surprise ourselves when checking out due to a lacking of transparency in the bills. Be careful! The top roof bar-terrace fantastic though, nice swimming pool with wews over the colisseum and good location. These are the only possitive things I have to say about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: lauradoc
Reviews.Content: Although the decor is a little outdated, this hotel provides the perfect base to explore Rome from. The metro station is a 5 minute walk away and there are numerous buses to get you across Rome. We had a superior room, which was still rather small but had a lovely view of the Colosseum. The showers are a bit small but the rooms are modern. Breakfast is quite expensive so we mostly went to a little cafe next door which sells pastries. The selling point for me was the rooftop pool, which is amazing - if you can get a sun lounger! Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for business trips to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is value for money. Located right next to the Collosseum, it is close to sights as well as business locations. The room was tiny but clean and comfortable, albeit a bit too warm in the night (no possibility to open the external windows wide). The breakfast is the usual standard. There is a roof terrace with pool and bar and splendid views over the city - ideal after a late arrival in town. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Roma Europride”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The shower is extremely small - I dont know how a grown man can shower in there? other than that the location is good and the hotel was a nice experience. the air conditioner is quite noisy and also would have liked more options re television channels. the breakfast was nice although it seemed every morning they were running out of space for everyone and did not clear the tables quick enough

Reviews.Title: “Good facilities and location but needs update..”
Reviews.Author: j_e_taylor84
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in May 2011 and having been to Rome before, knew the rough location to be ideally located to explore the colosseum and forum area very well. The hotel is a large building with a lot of rooms but good facilities. The pool on the roof has a fantastic view over the Colosseum and surrounding area and the weather in May was perfect to take advantage of this from around 12:00-15:00 when it was too hot to walk around and explore the sights. Although it is to the East of the city centre, we always walked to all of the sights and back out each evening for dinners in the Piazza Navona, Trevi and Pantheon areas without problems. The rooms could do with some updating but it is typical of this type of hotel. We also paid the extra for a superior room which had a view of the Colosseum but unfortunately this was only through what was effectively a port hole and the room was not any larger than a standard double so I wouldn't bother with this again. Overall though, we had a very pleasant stay, the staff were friendly, the facilities were good and the weather at the end of May was fantastic so can't complain at all...

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ben1981j
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for three nights in this hotel while staying in Rome. It has some good points and some bad. Not sure how they got a 4 star rating. Good: Location- 200m from most of the roman ruins. About 20-25 minute walk to Piazza Navona. Roof top pool and terrace - overlooking the coloseum. Express breakfast - good value Bad: The room: -Air conditioning DOES NOT WORK. Asked to have it looked at as there was lots of noise but no air coming out of it. Staff said that this is just how it is??? Checked another room just to make sure and it did not work either. Ended up getting an electric fan. -Fridge did not work -Wet carpet smell -Thin walls -Overall very outdated. Under staffed. The guys at the front desk are working solo most of the day and while I was asking about the air conditioning the guy had to deal with 2 other complaints (no toilet paper, internet not working). This hotel is is desperate need of a renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Main selling point: proximity to the Colosseum! The landmark is literally 200m up the road, and can be seen from the hotel rooftop bar and pool. The hotel is modern and clean, with excellent reception staff who were only too happy to assist with questions, directions, restaurant recommendations, calling a taxi etc. Public bus transport is right outside the hotel doors, while the train station is an easy 5-minute walk. The hotel is also within easy walking distance of internet cafes and laundromats. The only drawback is the hotel does not offer evening dining, and there are limited restaurants / food outlets in the vicinity. Overall, would recommend this hotel to visitors to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: arda80
Reviews.Content: Pro : The hotel is very close to the Coliseum, and the metro station Colosseo. Con : I guess it is not worth the price you pay for the room. By the way Rome is not for those who like nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “No free wi-fi”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed with a 4-star hotel where you cannot use wi-fi over your I-Phone. This is not acceptable. In 2011 you don´t need to travel with a notebook in order to navigate in internet. Everybody has a smartphone nowadays.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small rooms, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moffedillen
Reviews.Content: Good location two minutes walk from the Colosseum, with the Domus Aurea park next to the hotel. Helpful reception staff. The small rooms left a lot to be desired, definitely no 4*. No info folder, no 'Do not disturbe'-sign which you really need to hang on the door each morning, the AC is not possible to adjust, nothing in the minibar, no waterboiler for coffe/tea, the showerhead was so low I had to crouch to wash my hair etc. We went to the top floor to try the shallow swimming pool at 1830, still in the sun, and was chased away by the bartender because they had no lifeguard on duty.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean, poor breakfast, ideal as a sightseeing base”
Reviews.Author: florence034
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my Son during Easter break for a sightseeing trip. The location was excellent and very easy to walk to the tube station and the main sites in the South of the city. Roof terrace closed until May. The rooms and hotel were immaculately clean. The restaurant only serves breakfast and I was disappointed with the facilities, poor food and drinks, not enough available and very slow service to be seated. One morning we skipped our prepaid breaksfast after 15 minutes waiting to be seated as we were booked on a tour. The bar small and expensive for soft drinks. Staff were smart and polite. Room was very small. I found no atmosphere so believe it is an Ideal hotel if you intend eating out for all meals and just using it as a base. Two very good restaurants just around the corner compensated for no restaurant in the hotel. Wireless only free if owning a Vodafone account. Only free English channels working on the TV were news, others not working.

Reviews.Title: “Better then we thought based on other reviewers”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We requested a south facing upgraded room with view, and was quite pleasantly surprised with the accommodations. Yes, as others stated, there is a 2.5 ft concrete post in the room...but you just had to navigate around it. The Express breakfast @ 6 euros is fine, but full breakfast @ 15 E is overpriced...but not much near by. Lot's of 'tourist class' restaurants within walking distance open later in the day. Distance to Metro is a good mile with return walk on an up-hill slope. Again, we were pleased.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: ann186361
Reviews.Content: We had a room with a fantastic view of the colosseum. The staff were very helpful and friendly.We did not have breakfast as we thought it was a bit expensive.Would definatly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was great. Just 2 blocks from the Colosseum and the Metro. We were able to get to all of the key sites of Rome either by walking or taking the train in under 1/2 hour which was great! The service was outstanding. Everyone was very friendly and accommodating. The rooms were a bit worn and dated, but location and service made up for that!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Comfortable anf friendly”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Staff helpful, bright and cheerful. Breakfast in bar area is good value. Nice bar atmosphere for aperitifs before eating out in one of several local good restaurants. The hotel is conveniently located for Ancient Rome historical sites, particularly the Colosseum and Rome Forum sites. The Vatican City sites are within 30 minutes walking distance via much visited locations such as the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Pantheum and Piazza Navarone etc. Vatican tour with guide is recommended but be aware that the tour and guide costs do not include entry into the various sites' cost. For the Colosseum and Roma Forum a two-day pass can be bought (and is probably needed). Senior citizens have free passes!

Reviews.Title: “I thoroughly enjoyed staying here”
Reviews.Author: ChazzaBath
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice over the past couple of years and very much enjoyed both my stays. I found the rooms comfortable, clean, in good condition and with a good view of the Colosseum. The hotel is within very easy walking distance of the Colosseum and all of central Rome can be reached on foot from here. The hotel staff were always extremely helpful and friendly with getting taxis, moving luggage etc. I also very much enjoyed the breakfasts here. The food was fresh, tasty and plentiful. There are also several good restaurants for evening meals within a very short walking distance of the hotel. I also think that the price of the hotel was not bad for the location and overall quality.

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the parking fee was extremely high. i was glad the hotel offered an express breakfast at a lower cost. overall the hotel was not up to standrad with other accor hotels i have stayed at. the promixity to the the roman sites was excellent. although the site did mislead in saying the room had a view of the colosseo

Reviews.Title: “Good value near the Colosseum”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I often use this hotel as main base during my stays in Rome. Everything if fine, and breakfast on the top terrace with a view of the center of Rome is amazing. I only have two concerns: - sometimes I get single -bed rooms instead of a double-for-single-use - bedrooms on the street are noisy and pollution tends to get inside

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and good bargain”
Reviews.Author: Pups_Kalamaro
Reviews.Content: We got a fantastic offer for a double room with Last Minute and ended up paying average 85 euro per night. The rooms are small, true, but clean and nice, hotel staff friendly and helpful. Location is great, waling distance to the main ancient sites. Overall, we were very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: den_jasmin
Reviews.Content: They give us very bad room. In the centre of the room there's a pole. And it in the centre of the bed also...and we even can not watch the television...room also not clean. We already complain, but the guy in reservation said room is already full,..first time in my life...I have bad experience staying in hotel...and this mercure they supposed to be have standard quality room..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location !”
Reviews.Author: victory111
Reviews.Content: Room was small but very clean. The Colosseum is a five minute walk , maybe even less if your a fast walker. The hotel staff was very friendly. Everytime I had a question they were always ready to help. Also, there are a couple of pizza places in the area. At both places the pizza was good.

Reviews.Title: “A HOTEL CLOSE TO COLOSSEUM”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were lloking for a hotel close to colosseum and the historical center. We chose Mercure because we knew the general standards of these hotels and we didn't want "surprises" travelling with other people who we invited. Our expectations were satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Rome visit”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at the right place (in the heart of historic roman empire). The rooms are small but clean and tidy. However, I noticed two things lacking. 1. Internet facility for Guest use and 2. a electric kettle for making a hot cup of coffee or tea.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Run down rooms”
Reviews.Author: Dale L
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in Jan 2011. The reception area is welcoming but the rooms are poor and very dated. No tea and coffee facilities in the room and this from a 4 star hotel. No iron or ironing board so I had to use the staff room behind reception to iron my shifts, ridiculous really.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend to your hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Your hotel is very good. location very ok but room doesn't clean

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but poor rooms”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust24X7
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 10 people checking-in together but only half of us got the rooms. Finding rooms was a challenge as the hotel floors have some wierd spiral configuration and you keep circling around endlessly. Well the joy for lucky ones who got rooms (including myself) was short lived and ended the moment I entered the room. Three big steps and you reach the other end of room. Bathroom was a pigeon hole and still has a shower cabin squeezed in. But I couldnt dare to enter in it second time as it gives a claustrophobic feeling. Breakfast was a poor affair and nothing special to write home about with same spread everyday. Hopwever, full marks to location with Colosseum just a 5 min walk away. Overall, not recommended for any purpose, leisure or business.

Reviews.Title: “Run down and dirty but with good location.”
Reviews.Author: TheDane2 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If you like a 4 star hotel with dirty carpets, parts of the bathroom-ceiling missing, sporadic cleaning and staff most concerned with getting the highest commission from places they "recommend" you, this is definitely the place to stay !

Reviews.Title: “Uh Hum....”
Reviews.Author: crandieberry Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
