Reviews.Content: We spent total of five days, in general the staff was friendly but some seemed bothered when asked for help. The best about this hotel is that it is so close to the coliseum but other than that, the views and the rooms are nothing to die for. I would not go back since there are so many other hotels closer to the historical centre that are about the same in price or less.

Reviews.Title: “definately not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: potterh
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Mecure Roma Delta Colosseo for 5 nights during my stay in Rome in September 2010. This was my second time in Rome and I wanted to avoid the shaddy Termini station area so I picked this. I paid around 80 or 90 euro per night for a single room. Given that it was still a peak season and accomodation in Rome was on the high side and this is suppose to be a 4-star hotel under the Accord Group, I thought this was reasonable - well, I was probably wrong. I arrived late in the evening and made a mistake taking a cab from the side of the Termini station instead of from the main taxi line. I was charged 20 euro for a 4 minute cab ride which was suppose to be around 6 - 8 euro. The hotel staff checked me in quickly and showed me to my room. Well, it was a single room...it was clean but very dated. For a 4-star hotel, I was expecting something a bit posher and better. I stayed at a B&B in October 2010 for one night near Piazza Popolo for a lower rate and it was twice as big and much more comfortable. The good thing was that the location was very convenient. I have a small glimpse of the Collesum from my room. It's a 3 - 4 minute walk from the hotel to the Collesum and it is close to two metro stops (the A and B line respectively). there is a bus stop outside the hotel which takes you to many major attractions. Location-wise this hotel is great. There are some good resturants nearby the hotel as well and they offer free wifi (surprise surprise!). The hotel offers wifi but it's not free and very expensive. I'm not sure whether I will want to stay there again given that for the price I paid, I can probably have better options.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor room and an incredible small bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location is incredibly awesome. One block far from the Colosseo, and total access to the metro station even if you are carrying bags (or a backpack as I was). Simply awesome. Although, the rooms are really small, and the bathrooms are incredible small. I could not have a simply shower without hurt my arms in the windows cause the place to have a shower has less than 80cm x 80cm. Staff friendly and helpful. If you ask me if I would like to stay in the hotel, I would say yes. Simply because of the location and the staff. For a 2-night of sleeping, that is good.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with a couple of hiccups”
Reviews.Author: Chris - Steph K
Reviews.Content: Pros * Brilliant location, literally 300m from the Colosseum with a slight view from rooms. The hotel also has a roof terrace (although not open in winter) which offers views. * Included breakfast was nice - though probably a little expensive at 15 Euro if you have to pay for it. * Staff for the most part were friendly/helpful and all spoke and understood basic English. * Good size rooms & bathroom. * Air-conditioning works well. Cons * Room had an occasional sewerage like smell. The hotel staff attempted to mask it with a deodoriser. Wasnt too overpowering and didnt really affect us as we didnt spend a lot of time in the hotel. * Pillows were quite hard/uncomfortable. * Unusual pillar in the middle of the room directly in front of the TV which was slightly annoying but again, not unliveable. * Some fresh fruit would have been nice for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Rreview”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is good. Service is commendable. The hotel is clean, but I could not rate cleanliness high because the carpet is dirty and worn-out. If the carpet is changed, rating will be excellent.

Reviews.Title: “visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location in the centre of Rome! Nice and helpfull hotel crew! Comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “More Like a Motel 6 Than Four-Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CanonCityCO
Reviews.Content: Maybe our expectations for a hotel that was listed as a "four-star" hotel were too high, but this hotel truly colored our entire experience in our first trip to Rome. The room was no bigger than a cruise ship stateroom, and the bed was low and uncomfortable. Indeed, the room truly reminded me of a cheap cruise ship accommodation instead of a quality hotel room. The "king bed" was two twin mattresses side by side -- and the mattresses were somewhat uneven in height, making it hard to sleep anywhere near the middle of the room. The bedsheets had a metallic smell to them, further adding to the poor experience. The walls at this hotel are paper-thin, and you can hear everything going on around you. Apparently, what makes this a four-star hotel are the decent common areas and the existence of marble in the bathroom. However, marble does not quality make. The bathroom was shower-only, no tub, and the shower enclosure was literally 28 inches square. Unless you're a perfect physical specimen, you'd better hope you don't drop your soap or need to turn around. This place has great common areas -- the view from the rooftop is amazing. Further, the distance from the Colosseum simply cannot be beat. But, in the end, we decided to scrap the last night of our stay here and stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn by the airport -- which was a hundred times better in terms of quality accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for a 2.5-Star”
Reviews.Author: rehanhaque
Reviews.Content: My office colleague and I stayed here for 3 days, knowing well the standards of European hotels. The hotel has excellent location. I was apprehensive before arriving, reading the negative reviews on this site. I could see the Collesium from my window (on the 4th floor), which was cool. Positives: Excellent location, quite helpful staff, good TV service. Negatives: Stained carpet in room, the showers are so small that it is not even funny, paper thin walls. Labeling it a 4-star is wrong, totally. You need to manage your expectations. The location compensates for the negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms could use an update, the carpet was a bti tired, the showers could be larger, but the beds were extremely comfy and large and the staff were impeccable! I really found the staff extremely friendly and would go out of their way to chat and help guests out...I had a really great and relaxing weekend! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, super location”
Reviews.Author: Feyenoorder
Reviews.Content: We arrived in a cab and were greeted by a VERY friendly front desk agent, I was quite blown away by how friendly he was, welcoming us and while he was getting us checked in took a city map and told us all the places to go visit, how to get there, etc. I loved it. The room was small but adequate, the bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was clean. There is a fridge and a safe which is helpful. Television was good, had 5 or 6 languages, caught a few football matches from the Champions League. The location is the clincher, our room over looked the Collosseum, and you are walking distance the the Emmanuell Vittoria, the Roman Ruins, etc., and if you are a good walker you can walk to the Spanish Steps and the Pantheon, etc. The subway in Rome is excellent and cheap. Daypasses were like 2 Euros and well worth it. Catch a football match at the Olympico if you can, but buy tickets in advance, there are security restrictions that can prevent foreigners from buying tickets for certain matches.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Shejohn
Reviews.Content: Rome! We finally got here. Our previous attempt was ashclouded off and a mix pf personal circumstances and wanting to avoid the height of the summer meant we had to put it off until October. In spite of us being on a no cancellation, no change deal the hotel kindly let us switch dates on our reservation, showing a far more pragmatic attitude than many of the travel insurance companies that people were faced with. These changes were easily and promptly made by an exchange of a few friendly emails. On arrival the hotel was warm and welcoming. Check-in was efficient and friendly. Our room was small but more than adequate for what we wanted, somewhere to rest and sleep with aircon while exploring Rome. Just a short walk from the Coliseum the location was second to none. As with hotels in mainland Europe, tea and coffee facilities are not provided in the room. However complementary still and sparkling water is provided each day in the room's mini bar. The hotel also had a very pleasant roof top bar. We normally avoid hotel bars finding them sterile and over priced. I am not going to pretend this bar is cheap either but it is worth it for the experience and the bar staff friendly. Traveller's Tip 1: Hotel breakfasts don't really suit us (E15 in this case) as we only tend to go for a very light breakfast but the pleasant café on the opposite corner (just two tables) does croissants and cappuccino and you will get change from E5. Traveller's Tip 2: If you want to visit the Coliseum you can avoid large queues by purchasing joint Forum/Coliseum tickets at the Forum entrance. Traveller's Tip 3: Buy Vatican museum tickets on line or spend half your holiday in a queue. Traveller's Tip 4: Metro tickets and bus tickets cost E1. They are valid for one Metro journey and any number of bus journeys within one hour. A one day ticket for multi metro/bus journeys costs E4. Remember before jumping at the E4 ticket though that many places are walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “You pay for the location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Well I had reviewed some of the previous reviews and decided to book Mercure Roma Delta Colosseo as it was an Accor group and close to the Colossium and Ruins. Well the reviews were right, not the greatest hotel, but it had a bed for me to sleep in and that is all I needed. So the cleaniness wasn't the great, the room smelled and it was the bedding that made it smell, what ever the wash the bedding in needs t change. The room was small and the bathroom ws smaller and the shower was smaller still. Won't be staying here again. Not worth the price paid! The people in the bar were good, friendly and nice, gave me some nibbles with my drink even though I didn't ask for it!

Reviews.Title: “Solid little hotel with relaxed but goood service”
Reviews.Author: FTopGirl
Reviews.Content: Comfortable hotel in a good location. The front desk staff was friendly and very helpful. The room was very small, but comfortable and relatively clean (bathroom needed a little work, but I'm picky). The bed was very comfortable as well and for the most part the hotel was very quiet. Our window overlooked the Colesseum which was nice. The rooftop terrasse was a selling feature for us, but funny enough, we were too interested in being out and about in Rome that we never went up there. I would imagine it being nice in the summertime as it overlloks the Colesseum. Overall, if you are lookin for a solid hotel at a competitive rate in a great location, i would recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Value for money, with great confort and in a good location

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ga505
Reviews.Content: Only syayed 1 night (thank goodness) . Location was good, quite close to metro. Room was very small, AC didn't seem to work, grubby carpets, tiny shower, ensuite door wouldn't slide closed. Reception staff were OK on check-in. Had to go back to reception to collect bags after waiting 45 minutes. On checkout the reception guy handed me my receipt with no acknowledgement or even looking at me while talking on the telephone. I consider that quite rude. I have stayed at mercure properties quite a few times but would be reluctant to try again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: willtori
Reviews.Content: I was very scared reading the reviews and already booked , ready to go before I read them. I was prepared, no the rooms are not up to date in decor. The room was clean and large. The AC not working on the other reviews worried me for the time of year we were going. But the AC worked after you followed the instructions, so we always came back to a cool room after our days out. I thought the roof top area was one of our favorite night time events. We would come back worn out from all of our walking , go to roof enjoy the breeze and have a drink. The city changes at night and it was beautiful to watch every night. I enjoyed this hotel because of the price and the convience. I didn't expect a 5 star american hotel at this price. Be realistic and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Awful room, awful service, awful night of sleep. Not a 3 star!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location is great. But at that location, you can find much better places by the same price or less. The only thing that was great at this hotel. A got a superior room to have the Coloseo view. Not that nice view because the window has a fixed glass that did not open and was dirty. Impossible to get a nice view. The room was to noisy that was impossible to sleep. I could hear all the street noises. I do not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: Shez1111
Reviews.Content: I am unsure how this hotel managed to get 4 stars!!! * The room we stayed in had marks all over the carpet and walls, the decor was old and shabby. * The bathroom door would not open and close properly without a hard push!! * There were no coffee or tea making facilities, which i think is pretty standard in most hotels. If you wanted a cup of tea/coffee, you were expected to use room service and pay 2.50 Euro's for a very small cup of tea. * When I requested an iron for the room i was told I could use the one they had in the reception area!! It was rediculous! I had to stand in the narrow hallway of the reception area ironing my clothes whilst the staff tried to get passed me. * The terracced bar was closed and will now be closed until next summer. * If you wanted to watch TV or listen to the radio in any language other than italian, you had to pay 20 Euros!!!!! * Room service stops at 11pm I have stayed in some pretty cheap hotels in the passed and am not someone who complains much, but I paid a good price to stay at this hotel and It has got to be the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great short stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: JPCourt
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in Rome after a long flight from New York. You can see the Colosseum from the entrance of the hotel and many of Rome's attractions are within walking distance. The room was a suite with a decent sized bedroom and separate living area, each with its own TV. The couch in the living area was dated, but overall the room was nice. The staff was friendly and they had a parking garage underneath the hotel (for a small fee), which was very helpful since it's difficult to park in that area. They had a few choices for breakfast - for a full breakfast it was somewhere around 20 euro per person and for just coffee/tea and couissants it was 6 euro. I would highly recommend this hotel for a short-term stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Bilha Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good service and room, special location. With parking lot (not free) under the building.

Reviews.Title: “Great proximity to Colloseum”
Reviews.Author: ByronAuckland Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Really close to the Colloseum. Easy to catch a bus right out the front door or walk to the Metro. Next time however I would stay a little closer to the shopping district. The desk staff were pleasant. The staff in the restaurant for breakfast are so rude and unhelpful. It was an effort to bring cutlery and serviettes! We actually stayed there for the first 4 nights of a tour of Italy and one night before we left Rome two weeks later. On the first stay we had a standard room which was really spacious and very comfortable. On the second stay we had a superior room and it was not worth it. The room was way smaller and the walls were paper thin. My husband and I had to get up early (6am) to catch a flight out of Rome and the people in the room next door were banging on the wall - and we were not being noisy! It ruined my experience at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay when in Rome”
Reviews.Author: mirandaholland Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my mother and sister and we had one big room, The rooms maybe a bit dated but the beds were good, the room was always clean, and the bathroom worked well. The positive things of this hotel are: very good location (next to the Colloseum), on top of the roof ot the hotel is a swimming pool with terrace with stunning views: you can see several monuments of Rome. And the services of the hotel are great: hellping you planning your trips, finding restaurants (opposite the hotel are 3 good restaurants were many Italians come), calling taxis etc. The last thing I want to say is that on the roof of the hotel we ordered wine at the terrace and then we got some delicous appetisers from the house for free every time. No negative things about the hotel. Will go back in august 2011 again!. Miranda, the Netherlands

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Yottypete Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good location. Unfortinately got a smoking room and the airconditioner was very smelly. Overcame it by Ti Tree oil on a tissue at air discharge. Shower screen unmameageable and poured water on to floor. WiFi too expensive

Reviews.Title: “Comfort in the middle of Rome”
Reviews.Author: aussiefaraday Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: After staying in some really small and interesting places across Italy, it was nice to come back to the Mercure Delta Colosseo. The room is small in comparison to other countries, but for the most part it is on a par with most rooms in Europe. That means that yes, it is small in comparison to the USA, but comparatively, it was large when taken against other Italian hotels I stayed in. The rooms were very clean, and the air conditioning worked. Breakfast was a little expensive at 15 euros, but it was the only place we saw in a month that served eggs for breakfast. Most hotels across Italy call a 'large' breakfast the usual continental plus salami and cheese. The staff were extremely helpful and they spoke wonderful English. We had a problem with the safe in one room (we stayed here twice, once at the beginning of our trip, and again at the end), but the staff had it fixed before the day was out. This hotel is really close to Termini - in that you can walk your bags to it within about 15 minutes. The pool and bar on the roof had a spectacular view of some amazing sunsets over Rome - partly why we chose this hotel. You could do much worse than stay in this place, but if it is lots of space you are wanting in a hotel room, then don't come to Europe - you will be hard pressed to find a huge room. Do bring earplugs on your travels, if only because this is on a main road, and the ambulance sirens in Rome are unforgettable. Wifi was paid, and in the room via Vodafone. This wasn't the cheapest, but getting Wifi across Italy was a real challenge. It was nice to see it in a hotel room and not downstairs in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific staff, very friendly and helpful, especially reception”
Reviews.Author: Donny1234 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Room was fine but needed a little updating, especially the carpet which needed a good clean

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Great roofdeck with amazing views and service!”
Reviews.Author: AmberJean_8
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel about a block from the Colleseum. Great service, comfortable, awesome roofdeck, perfect location! We would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “In some way below my expectation”
Reviews.Author: Mortari Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was expecting from the hotel room a high space and quality when comparing with others Mercure hotels along the world. In general it was a good journey in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. But urgently in need of refurbishment.”
Reviews.Author: WorldBreeze
Reviews.Content: On this trip I chose this hotel solely for the location. I had stayed in Rome before and made the mistake of booking a hotel miles away from anywhere. With Rome's extreme traffic congestion you spend all day sitting in a jam unless you stay centrally. You simply cannot fault the location of this hotel. The Coliseum is a mere javelin's throw away, and there is a great view from the hotel rooftop......From the Coliseum you can jump on one of the many hop-on-hop-off tourist buses (18 Euros for a 2-day ticket) which means that you get to see all of the famous tourist spots without wearing yourself, bothering with maps or overpriced organised tours. When we arrived and tried to check-in, there was only one person on reception and he kept us waiting for over 20 minutes while he spoon-fed an Arab family's complete sightseeing itinerary for the next day.( I can't fathom why anyone would travel to a foreign country without doing this in advance for themselves via internet or guidebook). The one staff member seemed similarly harrassed the next evening. We finally got checked in,and were allocated room 614. The hotel only has a single tiny 4-person elevator, so the queue is fairly constant and we faced another 15 minute wait for our turn.... The room size was fairly large for a city-centre chain hotel... The bathroom was average size and the shower above the bath was adequate, though the seals around the glass screen were inundated with soap residue. In general, the decor had seen much better days. There were a large number of what appeared to be bleach-stains on the carpets both in our room and in the hallways. The bed - although fairly hard - was not too uncomfortable and we slept quite well. The good black-out curtains and quiet road to the rear of the hotel also helped.....The TV had only news channels in English; but then who goes to Rome to watch TV in their room and expects it to be in their own language? One thing not provided was a kettle and tea/coffee, which was a pain when we had opted not to take the overpriced breakfast. There also seemed to be no restaurant or room-service food...There was a small fridge with a couple of bottles of water in it, and restaurants and shops just around the corner. Another disappointment is that the pool was pretty much out of service as there was building work taking place around it. Lets just say that despite the day being 30 degrees, we weren't in any hurry to jump in the water while someone was using an electric drill and power saw alongside!! I wouldn't say this is the worst place we've ever stayed; But it its a long way from being the best...The location alone should really encourage Accor to develop this as a flagship hotel. However it presents itself as a budget offering in need of refurb.

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel...worth staying here!”
Reviews.Author: Soulman007
Reviews.Content: Having read both positive and negative reviews on TripAdvisor, I was a bit apprehansive about our stay here. I really shouldn't have worried. I was expacting a tiny room with a shower that I couldn't move in and had resigned myself to the fact that it was only for three nights and, after all, it was just a place to sleep in Rome. When we arrived the desk staff were professional and polite, we took the lift to our room on the 7th floor (723 to be precise) and I was really pleasantly surprised at how spacious the room was! Yes, there was a beam at the foot of the bed but it honestly didn't get in the way or obstruct the view of the TV from either side of the bed. (I'm still learning Italian so a bit of TV always helps!) The room was spotless and there were complimentary bottles of water in the mini-bar. The bathroom was more than big enough for two people, although we never actually tried both getting ready at the same time. The rooftop pool and bar are a major asset and Andrea and Maurizio were both very pleasant and helpful. We watched the sunset behind the Colosseum on one evening and it's a stunning sight. We were on holiday so i tend to order what I fancy and worry about the cost later so when our bill for room service and the bar arrived, I was pleasantly surprised that it wasn't as much as I thought it would be, so the prices aren't bad, either. We never ate at the hotel as there are so many places to eat nearby where you can get a coffee and croissant (cornetto in Italian) for less than 2Euros or a proper cooked breakfast for about 5Euros. Give the Mercure Delta Colosseo a fair chance, it's a lovely hotel but (like everywhere) I think you'd get slightly better service if you try and use a little Italian - not that you need to as all of the staff we encountered spoke perfect English. I just think how I would feel if someone came up to me in England and started speaking to me in a foreign language, I'm sure that I would be a little offended! On the other hand, if they spoke to me in even broken English, I would make the effort to try and understand and help if I can. We must (as a nation) really try and dispel the 'Brits Abroad' mentality. The world no longer owes us anything and it deserves some repect! In closing, go, just go! Spitting distance from the Colosseum and if you're quite hardy, you can walk anywhere in Rome from this fantastic, central location. PS. A one-day public transport card only costs 4euros so it won't cost a fortune to save your feet but check that there's a Metro stop near where you'll be hading home from.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DaniAJ
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as i suprise for my boyfriends 30th birthday, as we had been to rome before really wanted a hotel with a pool as it is just what u need after walking around sight seeing in the heat. I had read reviews on here before we came and to be honest was dreading it, but I clearly was worrying for nothing. I loved this hotel, all the staff were really friendly and helpful, they booked trips for us, reserved tables in resturants, all congratulated my boyfriend on his birthday, and if they were ever grumpy it was only because of some of the rude people who were staying there who thought they could just speak to them like dirt, i would have been in a bad mood too if i had to put up with that. Swiming pool was a lovely place to go and relax after a long morning out in the sun, very cold but just what we needed to cool off. Lovely lady called Andrea at the rooftop bar very nice even wehn under stress. The view from the rooftop was amazing, best in rome i would say, i wuld have paid just for that. Met a lovely couple from London and we shared some lovely wine from the bar, very cheap compared to others we got when out. Had a very nice double room, good size, good bathroom, clean and tidy, well that was until i unpacked. Dont know why people choose to complain about the rooms, how long do you really spend in there when you have such an amazing city to explore, a matress on the floor would do me, only in there to wash and sleep as there is so much more you could be doing with your time. I recommend the Hotel Manfredi for a meal which is 2mins walk down the road with a lovely rooftop resturant and the best food and service ive ever had. also the wine and grill bar up a side street by the trevi fountain, lovely food and live music to enjoy. Anyway i would recomend this hotel to anyone, hopefully will be coming back to rome and would definatley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good location, cold pool, dated rooms”
Reviews.Author: theboomtownrat
Reviews.Content: Getting from airport to this hotel is fairly straightforward. Airport to station Termini €14 by train then 2 stops on the Metro €1 to Colosseo. Turn left out of the station, walk up the road 7-8 mins, it's on the left. Reception staff friendly and seemed nice. Room wasn't ready so invited up to the pool terrace whilst we waited. Nice small pool but freezing cold!! Nice terrace area for food and drinks. Food reheated frozen but wine very good and reasonably priced, bottle of good wine €15. Nice view of Colosseum. Room was very dated and tired, reasonable size and clean. Small bathroom. Small fridge, no balcony - nothing to write home about. Bed fairly comfortable but noisy in the early hours if you fancy a lay in, eg you can hear housekeeping vaccuming nearby. No free wireless - unbelievable! We walked to most places, Colosseum, Trevi fountains, Spanish Steps, Pantheon, even the Vatican City and then stopped off for food on the way back at various Piazzas. Would recommend searching out Angelo at the Vatican City - American/Italian tour guide - very good tours. Food in Rome is generally poor, expensive and small portions. You could easily have two dinners! Pasta is served as a starter! A litre of beer is €16, small plate of pasta or pizza €15, easily €50 for a small lunch or dinner for 2. Aside from this, a beautiful city,lots of easily accessible attractions, perfect for a 3 day trip.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: RNMelbourne Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: stayed at Mercure Roma Delta for 3nights and had a great time. The hotel was nice, clean and staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: waley
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Mercure Colosseo prior to a cruise. It is a clean and tidy hotel with compact but comfortable rooms for the tourist who really only wants a place to sleep. The air conditioning is not brilliant but the temperature outside during the day was 34 degrees and not much less at night.. The air con unit is in the room on the floor and if your turn it off you can hear the one in the room above. But we still slept ok. Breakfast is more than adequate. The roof top pool and bar is a nice feature and drinks are not expensive. A 10 minute walk takes you to the Metro and a direct line (A) to the Spanish Steps. From there you have a leisurely walk to the all of the famous sites. A 5 minute walk takes you to the Colosseum and the ancient city. We tokk the package that included the Roma Pass. This gives free access to all public transport and museums. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: Mereor82
Reviews.Content: I spent a night in Rome at this hotel before continuing my journey on. I was extremely disappointed with the hotel. As I wanted to jam pack as much into the afternoon I had in Rome, I wasn't looking for a super 5* hotel, but somewhere that was at least clean and tidy. The whole hotel is dirty - there were stains on the floors, crisps troden into the carpets, it stank of smoke, there were stains on my towels. The room was tiny and there was damp in the extremely small shower room. In addition, the rooms were not at all sound proofed, so I could hear the couple's argument word for word next door and all night there were slamming doors as people returned back. When I arrived I did ask if I could get a quick sandwich at lunch - i was told the chef was on his break so I would have to wait an hour (this was at one o'clock...(!)). Terrible, terrible, terrible. I actually ended up leaving early for the airport so I could get a decent breakfast the next day...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel except for the cramped shower...”
Reviews.Author: chuiku2
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Mercure Delta Colosseo for two nights and was very happy with the location. It is very close to the Colosseum and my room had an excellent view of the Colosseum. The room was elegant, clean and at the right temperature. I had booked a single room as a solo traveller and maybe that worked against me. The bathroom was decently sized but the shower cube was very, very small. I couldnt turn to any side and the water could only flow over my head and chest. Maybe the bathrooms are bigger in the double rooms. There is a swimming pool on top and a roof top bar. Both are excellent. The service and the staff were excellent as is evident in any Accor Hotel. No wonder I am a member of A Club and always stay in an Accor Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: sharon_a_w
Reviews.Content: stayed in this hotel for a short trip to Rome. we found the hotel staff to be very friendly and helpful ( I had lost car keys on way to hotel they helped in contacting both airports taxi firm and airliner until keys were found.) Breakfast was OK plenty of food and choice only dislike was the bacon ( streaky ) .after walking miles around Rome it was nice to have a swim in the pool which stayed open till 8pm the view from the pool of the Colosseum is breathtaking ( small pool with life guard and towels ) the bar stayed open till 12 prices at the bar weren't that dear. as the hotel is only 250m from the Colosseum the noise of traffic at night is annoying ( london is louder ) all in all worth every penny. bonus on our booking that we were given rome passes which saved us some money and the map was usefull

Reviews.Title: “You do not want to stay here”
Reviews.Author: travelingmama51
Reviews.Content: Other than the rooftop pool this hotel had no other redeeming qualities. I thought I could put up with it for two nights but that almost became an impossible task. The room was tiny and we had stayed in other tiny rooms across Italy and France, but I was unprepared for the miniscule bathroom with a minute shower. I could not even bend down to pick the soap off the floor which I tried not to drop but unfortunately did. The air conditioner did not work and looked like a previous patron in frustration had ripped the controller right off . We complained and were shown two other rooms. One room was cooler but the racket from the air conditioner would have made sleep impossible. The other room was no better so we were given a fan and suffered in the 34 degree heat. The beds were impossibly hard and the pillows were like flat hard pancakes. We asked for another couple of pillows but were told that housekeeping was closed for the night. The next morning we asked for the pillows and still did not receive them until later in the day when I spoke to the manager. The most appalling thing we encountered was when we pushed the beds a little further apart was the collection of fingernail and toenail clippings on the filthy rug. The rug everywhere was impossibly dirty and the bedskirts were ripped. When we left it was none to soon, I could not have stayed a third night. I have written many trip advisor reviews and I always try to be reasonable with my reviews. I cannot find anything positive about this place other than its location and you can do much better for the same price elsewhere in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but.....”
Reviews.Author: alohakittyhawaii
Reviews.Content: This is at a great location!! Right next to the Roman Coliseum. It's a tiny bit of a walking distance from the train to the hotel but what a view to the hotel!! When I got their I met a nice front desk assistant who spoke english and was able to tell us where to go and how to get there. I did my research on European hotel rooms and was prepared for a tiny room. The room was tiny with a incredibly small bathroom. The shower was sooo small I felt closterphobic in it. It was also not to my cleaning standards. The bed was hard as a rock. I'm not kidding!! I read on their website that this hotel had AC but little did I know they only run it in the summer. I went in October but it was still very hot!!. I had to leave the windows open which let in alot of noise. We didn't even sleep with covers cause it was soooo hot. We knew they had a pool on the roof but knew it was closed. The front desk personnel still allowed up to go up their and take pictures. If you stay here please make a trip to the roof it's well worth it! You can see the Coliseum from there and if you go at night the Coliseum lights up and you can get amazing photos! I didn't eat their so can't comment on the food but all in all I wouldn't recommend this....only if you can't find a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place on a hot day”
Reviews.Author: Reisende0Mac
Reviews.Content: The pool on the roof have a great view of Colosseum. Nice place to cool down on a hot day. The rooms on 7th floor have problems with air conditioners. But the staff changed us to a another room with out any questions when we complaint. So this was a known issue. The WIFI internet is not working in this hotel. Vodafone is the poor provider.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: JanineinUK
Reviews.Content: Very dissapointed in this hotel. I'm loath to give it even a 3 out of 5, but here are the reasons; fantastic location, lovely pool on the roof and Sara who works on the roof terrace bar is a gem. Apart from that the room was outrageously small, bathroom little more than a broom closet and the service (apart from Sara) was perfunctory at best. It's laughable that the this Mercure is listed as a 4 star hotel. I can only assume that it's the pool that has allowed this classification. Very poor value.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: 4Chix
Reviews.Content: For the price, this was an awful hotel. When we checked in, we went to our room and the air conditioner obviously wasn't working (it was sweltering). So we were given a second room, and the air conditioner obviously wasn't working (it was sweltering). Then we were given a third room and the air conditioner was "working" but the air was barely blowing and still uncomfortable. But as the lesser of all evils we succombed to sleeping with no covers. Thank goodness we were only staying here for one night before flying out of Rome the next day. On the bright side, it is very close to the Coliseum, the main thing we wanted to see in our brief stay in Rome. The rooftop bar and pool were also a silver lining to the dark cloud.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Location! No complaints!”
Reviews.Author: Kittykat87
Reviews.Content: Stopped here with my boyfriend towards the end of March. Weather was lovely which really helped a we were doing a lot of sight-seeing. We arrived at the hotel about 8pm local time, were greated, checked in and taken to our room. I have to say, I had read reviews on here before I went and was a little bit worried about what the hotel was going to be like, but it was nice and a great place to rest those tired legs after walking around Rome all day. The room we had was quite small but it was fine for just the 2 of us. Bed was comfy, air-conditioning worked the only thing that bothered me a tiny bit at first was the, what seemed like constant, sound of police sirens going passed. After a while you just get used to it though and you dont hear that may during the evening and night. The food in the hotel is fine. Cereals, bread, cold meats, scrambled egg, sausages, pastries, etc etc is the breakfast meals, great to stock up on for the long day ahead. We didnt actually eat anthing else at the hotel. Location of the hotel is fab. As soon as you walk out of the main entrance and look right, you will see The Colosseo and what a beautiful sight she is. Its close to the Colosseo metro line which we used everyday to get all around Rome, very useful! The metro does tend to be very busy but it is very quick and efficient and is on time. I think the longest we waitied for The Metro was 3 minutes! We did pretty much the whole of Rome' famous sights in one day. As you can imagine, the feet were very sore by the end of the day. We had 2 days to go to The Vatican City and went to The Vatican Museums and Sistine Chapel which is amazing. I would really recomend taking time to do this. All in all, great hotel, great location, amazing place.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK”
Reviews.Author: romgrom
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for two days in June, '10. People at reception are pleasant and helpful, but needed to remind them several times: "that the air conditioner is not working and please have someone sent to fix it", but for some reason no reaction. Rooms were clean, but as correctly was mentioned in the previous reviews - small. Location is just close to Colosseo & center streets where you can do shopping. Pool is not big, but nice to have it on the hotel's premissies to chill out after a long day. Cannot say anything about the hotel's restaurant, didn't eat there. There's nothing special about restaurants around the hotel, but in the city's center you may find a good place.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic rome”
Reviews.Author: HobyJoby1
Reviews.Content: We went with my daughter and her boyfriend for her 21st birthday, and we booked this hotel as we had stayed before and had enjoyed our stay. We booked a superior room with a view of the Colosseum but upon arrival we had a superior room but with no Colosseum view because of overbooking. So after one night we had to both move rooms which was a bit of an inconvenience, they did give us a free drink each to compensate so it was not too big issue for us. The superior rooms are fairly large and of a good standard with 2 flat screen TVs, the bathrooms are not that big but adequate. you have an enclosed balcony which again is OK. The rooms are cleaned daily to a good standard. The roof top pool is a big bonus with good views of the Colosseum, although it was quite busy when we were there. The roof top bar is also good for a drink but it is a bit pricey but so is Rome in general. The breakfast is nothing to write home about and again is quite expensive, so if you want to save money you may be better going out to look for breakfast. All in all we enjoyed our stay with the location being excellent with good nearby restaurants, we would probably stay at this hotel again if we went back again to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ecuachevere
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel was amazing. The accomodations were excellent. The room was cozy, clean and unique. It is right in the heart of Rome, just two blocks away from the Colesseum and the metro(train station). If you enjoy walking, you can walk to any of the Rome's attractions from this location. What I enjoyed the most was being able to see the Colesseum from my room. We also had an amazing view from the rooftop pool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Bindi42
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel due to it's central location, only 10 minutes away from the colloseum. Walked to the colloseum daily to catch the hop on hop off bus - only 18 euro's for 2 days. Lots of good reasonably priced cafe's in this location and the metro station is situated next to the colloseum. Rooms were basic but clean and plenty of towels and toiletries provided, also the hotel provided 4 complimentary bottles of water in the fridge daily. Air conditioning was a bit weak but window's could be opened, staff were very accommodating and internet access is available for a charge. If you are booking any tours Dark Rome tours af the Vatican and Catacombs were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: JackLoToronto
Reviews.Content: I had read one bad review that had scared me, but my experience was totally positive. The location can't be beat. It is handy to everywhere, & there is a metro stop a block away. I actually could see the Colosseum from my room. The room was small but clean & fine for one person. The staff was polite and helpful. The young woman who served Continental breakfast on the roof (!) was thoroughly charming. The rates were very reasonable-I booked two months ahead. My only complaint was the shower stall-it was tiny. Street noise was nonexistent if you closed the window. Even open it didn't seem that bad.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable in the centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: family3Holland
Reviews.Content: we took this hotel because it is in the Centre of Rome and we could do most of the sightseeing by feet. First the hotel is only 10 minuits away from the Colosseo Metro. we came by taxi because we find a good price through the internet and so we didn't had to travel/walk with our luggage. We had a triple bedroom no. 512 which was a non-smoking room at the streetsite. Although many reviews told us that it was bad on the streetside, we can tell you that the traffic didn't bother us at all, (maybe because we were tiered) we only hear sometimes the ambulance or police which is a common thing during the day. Unfortunately the airco didn't function and the staf gave us a ventilator. luckely it was not hot. after 2 days they fixed the airco. in the refrigorator were some bottles of water for free. we then refilled the water from outside near the hotel and keep it cheap...! the bathroom was indeed a little tiny and there could have been some more light. we only found out later that when you are in the bathtub to shower the water was running under the bathwindow. so towels on the ground. the tv had not so many channels which was not so nice, because my teenagers kids wanted to look also some other programs while relaxing after a heavy day. the window of our rome was a door to a so called balcony which was behind glass, very hot! the bad thing is that the neighbour room was also sharing this little balcony, so you could not leave your windowdoor open.. and the matrasses were old they definitively need new ones, my son of 13 could easely sleep in the single bed. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel due to the ridiculous high price of 15 euro per person. Just across the street in S. Giovanni in Laterano we eat warm bread. hot chocolat and 2 coffee and a cake for only 15 euro in total! Look at Bar Colosseum which opens early in the morning it is on the corner. a positiv thing in the hotel is that when you need a taxi there will be arriving one in a few minuits, just order with the reception. the swimmingpool at the roof was already there filled with cold water but we couldn't take a swim. don't think of a pool it was more a big tub haha just to have a nice cold refreshment after a day of sightseeing. but indeed the view was very nice you could see the Colosseo. so after 5 days spending in Rome we were glad we had this hotel because it was close to many sightseeingthings. my tip for lunch or dinner is across the street you find staria Isidoro (Via San Giovani in Laterano) super! and across the hotel you find the St. Clements basilik it is worth to go in it!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Money”
Reviews.Author: SIEBENMEERE
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 triple rooms at a reasonnable rate for Rome in April. The rooms had space enough for 3 people and the bathrooms were big enough and we had no issue with the cleanliness. Rooms were on the 5th floor (512 and 513 interconnecting via a terrace). The location is good but noisy road in front so ask for upper floors. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is poor. Coffee and juices come out of a machine. Don't take it from there but ask for coffee to be served. Breakfast on the roof terrace is cheaper (continental only) but unfortunately not yet open during our stay. The pool was still closed too although end of April ? That was a little disappointing. But all in all, good value for money paid

Reviews.Title: “Basic but decent Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Multatuli_On_Wheels
Reviews.Content: You are in the old center of Rome, in a clean modern hotel, very close to the colosseum (5 Min. walk) and what you pay per night is very reasonable compared to other hotels in the old center...Well, we were certainly not disappointed with our choice. There are indeed arguments to find that a four star rating might be overrated because the rooms and the bar-bistro look to small and simple, but everything is up to decent standards. The location is exactly at a start point (or end point if you like) of the touristic route between Piazza del Popolo and the colosseum. Al monuments are within walking distance there. For the Vatican or the nice area of Trastevere, you better take a taxi which we also find reasonably priced. The rooftop of this hotel offers nice views on the Collosseum and Rome and there is a nice bar and swimming pool. Unfortunately, early March it is still to cold to use those facilities. Only negative critic I have on this hotel is that matresses on the beds could have been better. Al other criteria were within expectations and we were satisfied with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rustySouthWales
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 4 nights in September 09. We arrived before the check-in time for our room, the receptionist offered to store our bags and showed us where we could freshen up, extremely helpful and it allowed us to pop out in the local area (which was right by the Colosseum) until the check-in time! The receptionist also gave us a map of Rome and circled places of interest, metro stops and any restaurants that he thought were good!! - Extremely helpful and polite! Rooms were of a good size, our room also had a small balcony and a good sized bathroom - with a powerful hair dryer! The roof terrace was lovely, beautiful views of the city! The roof top bar did very nice cocktails too, although we only had a couple during our stay - they were quite expensive! Overall a good hotel, in a fantastic location - couldnt have asked for more when on a city break!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, close to sights and centre”
Reviews.Author: cerbera69
Reviews.Content: Stayed here fo r5 nights on business. Good Base Camp for my customers and my office, and also for sight seeing in the evenings. what can you say .. its a hotel . clean, good breakfast, staff friendly, helped me organise Taxis to customers / Internet access / Maps & to confirm my flights. Nearest Metro station is a good 20 minute walk away, but walking past the collosium every day wasnt a problem. Some local food restyeraunts and also Icecream parlours. Swimming pool on rooftop terrace was closed dur to it being out of season !!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely noisy”
Reviews.Author: das_ubersoldat
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend there and got already upset with the reception: I have an A-Club Gold card and one should get a room upgrade (if available). reception confirmed that better rooms are available but stated we would have to pay for it. after some discussion his colleague called the a-club hotline in italy and they confirmed it (my girlfriend speaks fluent italian and understood the conversation). she told him in italian that the upgrade is ok. then he started telling me in english that for rooms upgrades we would have to pay. my girlfriend told him that this is not what his colleague just told him. the colleague then suddenly dissapeared. as a courtesy of him we got a 3 bed room (this is not an upgrade; just a room with three beds). btw. we booked the full rate not something discounted. the rooms itself are very tiny and ours had a column in the middle of the room and the end of the bed so if you are tall you might hit that column all night. the bed mattresses were old and worn. the noise of the street was simply amazing. even when you closed the windows it was so loud that one night we had to sleep with earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible - how can it claim to have four stars?”
Reviews.Author: Mark241
Reviews.Content: The staff are friendly and the location good. That's about all that I can say that's nice about this place. My room was next to a busy road - rumbling through the night with heavy goods vehicles and motorbikes taking turns to wake me up throughout the night. The food service provided by the hotel consisted of reheated frozen food. To be fair to the hotel, they did suggest that I might prefer a local restaurant (!) but you can tell that when hotel staff are openly suggesting this, things are pretty bad. Rooms are tired and in desparate need of a refurbishment - sticking in a flatscreen TV doesn't make up for the shabby, stale look and feel of the place. Didn't stick around to find out any more - I checked out the following day and checked in to another hotel instead. I'm not quite sure how this hotel has earned four stars - it's three star at best.

Reviews.Title: “Well - it is in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: H0neybeethree
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location and a reasonable price for it; but ... the rooms are very small and dark . I honestly cannot remember what the bathroom looked like because I think I have blocked it. Needed to use an iron for a pair of trousers and was sent to a back room behind the front desk using an iron from 1950's. Staff were fine but seemed very frazzled and busy.

Reviews.Title: “had to sleep on floor!”
Reviews.Author: sweetHarribo666
Reviews.Content: my partner and i travelled to rome for a weekend break. we stayed 3nights. and 2 out of the 3 nights, we had to sleep on the floor next to the air con, as it was so hot, and the air con was very weak, the air did not blow out strong enough to reach us in ur beds. we are very upset by this, and when we did speak to someone on reception, they said they could not move us, as it was in the middle of the night. the rooms are very small. im not sure why there was a great big pillar stuck in the middle of the room. i do think they need to sort out the air con. and to deny us to change rooms for the night. and we had to suffer and sleep on the floor hugging to A/c is unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Book here”
Reviews.Author: ydda
Reviews.Content: OMG this hotel is horrible. I met my daughter at the hotel to spend some time with her. She was doing a college internship in Italy. As soon as I got there I was told that the safe could not be fixed to carry mty things with me. Few hours after I got there I was robbed in front of the hotel. I ran in to the hotel but the attended locked me out. I had to bang on the door to be let in. Crazy. Once I was in he wouldn't call the police for me. He told me to walk to the station. Then, the internet wasn't working so I couldn't can my cards and information. He wouldn't even let me use there phone. I spent the next few days getting passports and feeling scared and unwelcomed. They just treated my daughter and myself as immigrants. They then charged me for meals that I should have gotten for free. This is far from a 4 star hotel. Think again about booking here., it's just not worth it!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel but not great.”
Reviews.Author: passenger94
Reviews.Content: Stayed for several nights, room was a little small but not cramped, however it smelt badly of stale cigarettes, which was disappointing. Stayed away from the breakfast as it seemed a little overpriced. Found staff were pleasant and efficient, overall hotel was quite pleasant. Proximity to coliseum and public transport was great, plenty of restaurants in local area. Considered the wireless internet fee to be overpriced. If it wasn't for the stale smelling room I would have been happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “poor management”
Reviews.Author: rogeraaz
Reviews.Content: I reserved a double room for 8 days. I was unable to make the trip. I called in time per their policy to cancel my reservation. Management refused to give me a refund for any of the time. I understand that losing the first night's payment is part of the process but not refunding any of the other money is tantamount to fraud.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate at Best”
Reviews.Author: bsh031
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here on our recent trip. I would say that it is an average hotel at best. Good location convenient to the Colosseum and the Metro. The rooftop view of the Colosseum was amazing and there is a small pool on the roof. There were nice restaurants nearby as well. We had a double room so it was larger than most. Our room was said to be non-smoking but still smelled of tobacco. We had a support column at the end of our bed which was just annoying. The maid knocked on our door to vacuum in spite of the "Do not Disturb" sign. (Not a huge problem but as we had flown all night we might have been asleep- just the principal do not disturb should mean just that) The wi-fi was weakly available in the bar. It is fine if you spend no time in your room and are a bare minimalist but as for us we were exhausted after sight seeing all day and wanted to come back to a nice room. (We even changed to another hotel.) The picture on the web site of the opulent lobby is a true picture but does not reflect the rooms - do not expect the nicety of the lobby in your room. And they just need new carpet the carpet was shabby everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a couple days”
Reviews.Author: PMdivers
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about a 2 star. It is fine for a place to throw your luggage while you visit Rome. The location is great and the best thing about the place is the rooftop pool. It's lovely for a swim after a day of touring and the view is unbelievable -- over the rooftops of ancient Rome. The room was so tiny, one of us had to sit down so the other could get to the equally tiny bathroom. Carpet was very dirty. Breakfast was the worst I've ever had in my life. So bad we were laughing hysterically. If you're visiting Rome for romance or for a longer stay, look for another place.

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: victoria_may_6
Reviews.Content: hotel close to Colloseo, clean rooms, delicious breakfast and very nice and helpfull staff, I can just reccommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Views of the Colosseum and a rooftop pool”
Reviews.Author: thompsontravellers
Reviews.Content: A great hotel located near the colosseum with a rooftop pool. The hotel allows for car parking which is convenient and we had a spacious room.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD BUT COULD CHOOSE BETTER”
Reviews.Author: WomanfromOz
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a single room, which was tiny but really, who cares as I was never in it. As someone said previously, views and close to the Coliseum but after a while, well you know ...... The shower was really tiny, and if you were a larger person, you probably would have difficulty. No way possible to shave your legs. I had to shut the bathroom door as all I could was every toilet flushing within the hotel (well so it seemed LOL). The carpet in the room badly needed cleaning, but otherwise the room was clean. Another issue was the cleaners started around 7.30 - 8.00am with the vacuum, so not a lot of chance for a sleep-in. Sounds like a picky review, but I was happy enough here, perhaps would have been better to stay closer in to the city, but all in all was good enough for the time I was there (three nights and to sleep only). But yes, it was a shame that the internet cost so much too - 15 euros for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel to spend holidays!!!”
Reviews.Author: Masowm20
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife visited Rome recently. We spent 2 nights at Mercure Roma Delta Colosseo. The only good thing about this hotel is its location which is few hundred meters away from the magnificent Colloseum and good connectivity with public transit system. The rooms at this hotel are scruffy and very badly maintained. Though I requested a non smoking room during my booking, eventually we were given a smoking room. The moment we entered the room it was stinking everywhere. The floor carpets are full of stains and it looks like it has not been replaced since ages. The bathroom is also in a bad shape and the most of the bath fittings are getting corroded. With regards to breakfast, it’s an absolute waste to have it in this hotel. The hotel management should take these things seriously into consideration and improve the facilities at this hotel. At the end, I would like to say that staying at this hotel is certainly not value for money. I would never recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “went for our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: bigmanCardiff
Reviews.Content: Gutted is all I can say Room was very shabby we have stayed in nicer travel lodges , it was clean in all fairness but really in need of decorating , I have taken photos as the walls were covered in scratches and scuffs , the balcony def had not been cleaned for months and was filthy The breakfast was the same every morning , tinned sausages , scrammbled eggs very greasy bacon and peas of all things , we are very chilled people and have never used a site like this but due to the amount of money we paid £1200 for 6 nights feel very very let down . Staff fab roof top pool amazing , would we stay here again - no way Be warned too it is very very noisy on a main road with police sirens constantly going off

Reviews.Title: “Well below mercure standard - don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: sirpeevedalot
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be downgraded to "Ibis" standard or less. The decor was old and shabby. You will be sorely disappointed if you think you are getting what the photos on the accor website display for this hotel. Also, we checked in at 3.45pm and our room was not ready. It's saving grace? Good location and the bar staff were lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed for the amount paid”
Reviews.Author: Dodgers01
Reviews.Content: Firstly to get to this hotel from Ciampino airport should be a set rate of €30 don't pay any more than this and agree this price before you get in the cab. When arrived at the hotel i thought what a great location, with views of the colosseum is mainly what you pay for. Pro's of this hotel are: Great location, nice hotel some parts could be upgraded but ok, great for bus routes (bus stops nearly outside the hotel and Colosseo Metro is a 5 minute walk away) it has a swimming pool that is well looked after and a roof top bar which is a little pricey €5 for a glass of wine and €4 for half a pint of beer but is nice to sit and relax up there. Con's of this hotel: The rooms are small. Add all this up and i think this is great value for money, we booked through the Mercure website and got the room at a very good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Generally good but a couple of issues - AND some tips for Rome”
Reviews.Author: nickster99
Reviews.Content: (This review submitted by a 33yo Australian male). Great location: 5 minute walk to the Colloseo Metro station. 3 minute walk to the Colloseum. Room was ok: I had a single room which was a single bed. Also make sure you press for a non smoking room because although I booked a non smoking room they had none and I was in a smoking room. It didn't smell awful or anything but there definitely was a smoking odour in the room. Tiny shower: If you're rather tall (i'm 6ft2/188cm) you will find the shower in the single room quite small. Internet/Wi-Fi: It's not free. It's provided by Vodafone. Despite what the Boingo website says, Boingo DOES NOT ROAM with Vodafone Italy. The cost was 15 EURO for 24 hours access. General tips for Rome: If you're heading in summer when it's hot you'll want to drink lots of water. Don't get sucked in to buying expensive bottled water at places near tourist attractions or you might end up paying 3 EURO for a 500ml bottle of water. Head to a little supermarket (there are quite a few around - eg there were 2 within 100m of the colloseum) where I bought 3 bottles of 500ml cold water for 0.15 EURO. yes! 15 cents! If you go to a restaurant that has a set menu for say 15 EURO you will get stung on the drinks. As soon as you sit down they will ask what you want to drink. A coke will cost you 4 EURO! So either don't order a drink or just get a bottle of water (usually 2 EURO) or just wait until you see the menu before ordering any drinks! Buy the ROMA Card online and pick it up from the ROMA Card office near the Termini station. It cost around 30 EURO which gives you a 3 day public transport pass and entry to two venues (eg Colloseum/Forum). You don't save any money really over buying this separately but it means you get to bypass the queues and get straight in. EG at the colloseum I went straight in without queuing whereas the queue to buy tickets there was about 100m long. For the Vatican: Getting a guided tour is well worth it. You can buy this online also or at the venue. You get a guide to show you around. The price of the tour (around 35EURO) includes the entry fee (which is around 15EURO by itself). IMPORTANT: If you are a woman or a man, you will get denied entry into St Peter's Basilica if you're wearing a tank top or something that shows your shoulders! A woman in my group got denied entry and there was nothing she could do to convince them to let her in!!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: MorkUk
Reviews.Content: Lets start with the positive, I received the usual good service that I’ve so far received at the accor chain, but we had problems! We booked a superior room, which has a view of the colosseum. We had a shared balcony, which was about 4ft square and enclosed with glass, so pretty unusable. This was in the sun from about 11am until sunset and it trapped a phenomenal amount of heat that was unable to escape. This made our room absolutely roasting hot, the poor aircon has no-chance! The thermostat indicated the temperature to be about 32-35c, I think it was ‘only’ about 30c though. As you can imagine, sleeping was tough, but the bed was also terrible with a plastic mattress protector. I’ve never experienced anything like that and really ruined the last stop of our holiday. I’ll also note … - the room was small - bathroom show curtain was filthy. After 2 days we moved to another room on the 7th floor that didn’t have a balcony, great views and it was cooler, but still 23-25c I’d say. I’d give this room 7/10 as the first room would struggle to get 2/10!! I must say that my friends who stayed in a twin (1 double and a single bed) had a huge room, which appeared much better. Anyway, the pool closed at 2000 and is only 100 or 120cm deep so I was a bit disappointed and as you’d expect the bar was expensive. You have those views of the colosseum, which look good in a photo, but they get a bit boring as you walk past it at least twice a day! It’s 20-30 mins walk to the pantheon and 30-40 mins to Trastevere (where the locals go for nightlife and restaurants), but if you fancy a gay bar, there are a number between the hotel and the colosseum.

Reviews.Title: “Don't unless you get a cut-price deal”
Reviews.Author: Eltel6
Reviews.Content: Everything said in all the reviews here is spot on -- which means it might be worth a stay if you can bag yourself a great rate and you don't mind some of the negatives. But this place is otherwise a bit of a disappointment. And definitely not a four star. Good location, close to the Colosseum, and an excellent rooftop pool and bar. That alone makes it fantastic value, especially in August's intolerable heat. My air conditioning worked really well, the room was nicely decorated and had a very comfortable bed. And I liked the marble bathroom too. But like other reviewers I noticed the carpets were a bit stained. And I have to admit the shower was probably the smallest I have ever seen. You might understand it in an old converted building but it's strange in a purpose-built hotel. I dropped the soap once and there was absolutely no chance of bending over to pick it up. I'd hate to see what would happen with someone who might be a somewhat bigger than the average size... Then there is the totally random service. A few of the staff were professional and helpful, as you would rather hope to expect in the service industry. Far too many though were indifferent or useless or busy imposing pointless and petty rules. I arrived very late and exhausted after a delayed flight to find that the bar had closed 10 minutes before -- and was told with raised eyebrows and pursed lips that there was absolutely no chance of getting a glass of wine or a can of beer. And no, they don't actually put any drinks in the mini-bars "because too many guests were stealing." Go out and get your own. At midnight. The rooftop bar is lovely but the lady at the front desk was absolutely insistent that they've "never served breakfast there" -- yet another small pleasure that was thwarted by some apparent head office directive. How difficult would it be to allow your guests to take their coffee up to the roof? How much trouble would it be to reach into a fridge and hand a mini bottle of wine and a glass to an exhausted traveller? What on earth is the point of an empty mini-bar -- especially if you've taken a credit card imprint? One last bit of petty bureaucracy. My friends and I were sitting in the open-air, rooftop bar after going for a swim. The barmaid came over to say that the rules required the girls to cover up their swimming costumes. The men were told they didn't need to. Presumably a bloke could sit there in the skimpiest Speedos without causing problems -- but the female figure is too offensive for the other guests to see. Erm... next to the pool. Despite all this I would stay there again. I got an amazing deal with Expedia which basically got me a room for 50 euros a night. If I'd been paying their advertised rate of 171 euros I would be fuming.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: lena1979
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mercure Delta Colosseo wit my husband for his birthday and it was lovely. We had a fantastic view of the Colosseum from our balcony, which was very special. The rooms were clean and very spacious for a city centre. It was a bargain price too, though I understand it is usually a little more expensive. The hotel provided a great base for a Rome stay. I'll definitely return and next time I'll make sure to do it when the rooftop pool is open!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, quiet neighboorhoud”
Reviews.Author: NorthernlightsNorway
Reviews.Content: While the date was not 2006, it was in 2003 I was at this hotel I just wanted to write a review stating how I felt about the hotel. Rooms were okay, probably a bit old and not up to date but good enough. Breakfast was good, loved the pastry:) And watch it, we got 50 Euro stolen from our hotelroom! I am not accusing anyone but lock in all your belongings, Rome is a city were your money can dissapear in many different ways... This is one of the few hotels with a swimmingpool and MY GOD was that a good choice:) We spent all our mornings and midday at the pool since it was too hot to do anything else. It was lovely! Then about 2 pm or so, we got dressed and went for the subway or took a cab to the center. I really liked this hotel and the location. In Rome you do not need to live in the busiest area! Watching the Collosseum at night while sharing a glass of wine is something I'll never forget.

Reviews.Title: “If you want good location, this is a good choice”
Reviews.Author: Lisphy
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, had colosseum view from the room I stayed. but as a four star the room is too small and the carpet wasn't clean. Also, the continental breakfast costs 15 Euro which is a bit too expensive. Italian breakfast is 6 Euro but doesn't worth it. No free internet access, need to use Vodafone wifi, again it's quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Lollee
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 days, we arrived to a full reception and total chaos, when we eventually were served we had to wait an hour. When we did get to our rooms I could not belive the state of it, we had a so called balcony which was absolutely filthy ( you cannot get out onto it as its locked). The carpet was stained, the bathroom was ok. You really need good air conditioning when staying in Rome during the hot periods but the air condtioning was sub standard and barely cooled it down. The best thing about this hotel is the pool and the views from the top of the roof. The rooftop bar is staffed intermittently and not at all on a Sunday. The breakast costs 15 euros and its the normal continental breakfast (in my opinion not worth it). I definitely would not recommend this hotel to anyone, there are far more suerior hotels nearer the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Very good base to explore the city”
Reviews.Author: geogforever
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 4 nights which was an ideal length of stay. we had a triple room which was very spacious and bathroom was a good size (room 513). we had a shared balcony overlooking road which we only used to dry our clothes. the air conditioning was a necesity with it being extremely hot outside. the staff at reception spoke very good english and were very helpful. the rooftop bar was manned from 11am to 11pm, the drinks were quite expensive and the food was frozen food. however there was plenty of seating. the rooftop pool was the factor we chose this hotel and it was never too busy and not too cold. the view from the roof was amazing and it was only a short walk into city centre. the only really bad point is the breakfast, we had it on the first day and it was horrible!!!! it is not worth 5euros let alone 15! advice = use supermarket - less than 5 minutes walk away where you can buy ready made rolls and also cheap alcohol! get a taxi to the vatican cos its not much rather than walking! i advise a tour because you get loads more info and access to extra areas. definately buy your ticket from the palentine rather than queueing at the colosseum. definately visit the trevi fountain in both day and nightime. great trip and would definately use this hotel if i ever visit rome again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service Value & Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaximusCanada
Reviews.Content: Hats off to this hotel. 4 Minutes walk to the Collosseum, very clean, helpful staff. The pool is georgeous and the rooftop patio is also very nice as it overlooks the Collosseum. The room was clean and very well presented. There was air conditioning, tv, patio, bar, etc. Would reccommend this hotel to anyone and will stay there again next time we visit rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not in a milion years a 4 stars Hotel... More like a Up Market Hostel”
Reviews.Author: LaureanoKent
Reviews.Content: This hotel is unbelievable bad. I stayed here for 4 nights in June/2009 (10/06 to 14/06) and I had one of the worst experiences of my life. I am a member of the A-Club (Mercure loyalty program) and that was the reason why I had chosen this one for my stay in Rome, but in no way this hotel is up to the Mercure standard. During my arrival I was offered a non-smoking room with 2 beds (my booking was for a smoking room with a double bed), after some conversations the only helpful person during my whole stay (Alessandro), offered me a second room, which was very small (room 111). To cur a long story short: a) The bathroom had to be blocked as the shower box would become a swimming pool; b) Don’t even think about in eating at the hotel, the portions are really small and the prices are really expensive. A baby would be left starving after eating one of them! When I complained to the staff she was really rude. They focus on the problem not on the solution. c) They serve food in plastic plates and drinks in plastic glasses (Is this the standard for 4 star hotel??? I don’t think so) d) The breakfast is expensive and all the 4 days lacked food. In one day half of the people in there were waiting for basic stuff, like bread and cheese. e) Someone placed a “Do Not disturb” in my door and as a result the room was not clean. When I rang reception by the end of the day, I was informed that nothing could be done; that they do not had maids at 7PM. Again 4 stars hotel?????? God help us! Anyway, stay away from this Hostel, unless you want to have your holidays fulfilled with problems. Find a better place and enjoy Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location right by the Colosseum”
Reviews.Author: sailornep5
Reviews.Content: I won this hotel through Priceline at the terrific price of $118/night - a great deal considering Priceline wins guarantee double rooms, which were going at the regular rate closer to $300 on every other website. We got to the hotel much earlier than the 3pm check in time, but the staff graciously held our bags while we toured around the city and gave us an upgrade when we returned. The "upgrade," which gave us a sliver view of the Colosseum if you strained your eyes from the tiny window, was into a smoking room, which I didn't like. But when I walked in, the room surprisingly did not smell like smoke at all, so I was pleased with the results. This was the first European hotel where I thought the star category matched the US standard - I've been in several European hotels where their 4 or 5 star category is equivalent to a Holiday Inn or Motel 6 in the US. This room was cramped, but modern enough with all the right amenities, which lined up with their 3 star category rating on Priceline. I'd say it was equivalent to a Courtyard by Marriott standard in the US. It was comfortable and clean. The only complaint I have of the room is the ridiculously small and awkward shower - I am a small girl (5'4", 115 lbs) and felt like I took up the entire shower. My husband (who is substantially larger) said it felt like showering in a coffin. There was virtually no way for me to start up the shower without getting water all over the place or for me to be inside and be sprayed with freezing (or burning) water. Twice on our three day stay the elevators stopped working, forcing customers to walk up the stairs to get to their rooms. We were on the 4th floor, so luckily only had a few flights to walk....not sure how the poor souls on higher floors did it, especially if they had luggage! The hotel did not issue out any apologies or assistance for the problem. The hotel is a comfortable five minute walk to the Colosseum and Metro station. I wouldn't pay regular rack rates for the room, but if I snagged another deal like the one I had, I wouldn't mind staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: EricArthurBlair
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 2 nights paying really low fare, since I've booked from Accorhotels website and there was a "last minute promotion", less than 150 euros for the two nights. The staff was a bit rude when we've arrived, as they didn't find my reservation and said that "the system shows me I'm fully booked". But then, the man reloaded his system and there was my reservation. I didn't pay for the breakfast but I wouldn't recommend it, as long as there're a of choices just crossing the street and walking a little (it seems that there's a college about 300m crossing the street and there're a lot of cafeterias, maybe for the students). The location is amazing, from the roof you can take nice pictures of the Coliseum, that is just a few steps from the hotel, the "coliseo metro" station as well.
