About the roof, all complainings about no staff in the roof bar are true. I've been in the roof the two days I've stayed there and I've only seen a guy cleaning the pool. The room and the bathroom are a little old, needing refubishment, but OK for the price I've payed. The regular fare is unreal, more than 150 euros per night, and if you don't get a promotion as I got, don't stay there.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT STAY”
Reviews.Author: Budagali
Reviews.Content: Our trip did not start out that great since our luggage was not put on the plane we arrived with. We eventually got it the next day. Now about the Delta Colosseo, I was abit worried when I read the hotel reviews. However we had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The staff were amazingly great and helpful. The room we got was nice though it needs abit of refurbishing but it was nice. The location was the absolute best and not far away from from the main train station if you take the metro. We had alovely stay and consider returning.

Reviews.Title: “Close to colossuem”
Reviews.Author: MeathJohn
Reviews.Content: My wife & i recently returned from a 3 night stay, we had a superior room with a view of the colosseum, the room was small like many Italian hotels, bathroom was small and shower/bath was extremely small, room was clean, some carpet stains. The a/c was excellent and was needed by us, and a must have for the hot summer months. It was disapointing the rooftop bar was closed, we were told it only opens in june ! Bar service is slow, even when only a few in the bar, staff are very nice. Hotel is 5 mins walk to the Colosseum and metro stop. Ice cream shop next to the hotel is fab. we did not eat in the hotel with breakfast at €15, there are several places to eat on the way to the colossuem and also to the left of the hotel. would overall recommend the hotel & location, metro is easy to use to get around Rome, buy a €2 ticket for all day travel & definitely bring comfortable walking shoes.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for cost/location/quality ! A+”
Reviews.Author: xveronicax
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Delta Mercure this weekend for 3 days/2 nights, and was overall very pleased with the experience. My dates were April 10th, 11th, 12th 2009 - Easter weekend, my rate was 109 Euros/night, my room was 303 (standard double ). Arrival - Our easyjet flight had us at the hotel at 9h; despite check-in being at 14h, we were given a room right away. We requested a room with a view of the Colosseo, but all were taken. We got to our room on the 3rd floor (facing the street), and were surprised to see that we did have a view afterall. (Seems that certain rooms are "official view rooms", and others aren't since the view isn't that great..); all street-facing rooms can see the Colosseo, as long as you're above the 2nd floor, I would imagine. Room - the room is "correct" as they say; nothing fancy (and weird column in the middle..). Everything was spotless and new-looking. The bed was okay (I think it might have been two twin mattresses pushed together, which wasn't that amazing. The room is small for American standards, but normal for european standards. There's a big wardrobe to store your clothes, a safe, fridge, a big window, etc. Area - by far, one of the best features of this hotel, and the main reason I chose it in the first place. The Colosseo quarter is calm, clean, and you feel safe. It's literally right in front of a bus stop that is serviced by 10 lines, and five minutes walking from the Colosseo (and thus, the metro). There's a grocery store closeby, and this is perfect for doing a little shopping and having a picnic lunch in the beautiful park that is 30 seconds from the hotel. We walked from the hotel to the vatican (which is pretty far) and it only took us about an hour. The taxi ride cost 9 euros to the trastevere neighborhood. Staff - In short : very good. Though, I must admit that the women on staff were significantly more pleasant than the guys. They helped us make reservations, gave advice on restaurants/buses to take/etc. Pool : Closed until at least Mid-May. Summary : very satisfied with the stay, and found the price/quality aspect to be quite appropriate.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: alishelly
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from Rome as a 50th birthday suprise from my husband I have to say I was very dissapointed with this hotel.Our room was on the first floor with a lovely view of the bins, it smelt heavily of stale cigarrette smoke and was very small. During the night we were kept awake be the generator which was just outside our room and some rather peculiar noises coming from the plumbing system. The hotel is in desperate need of a refurb as the room and the corridors looked decidedly grubby. To be fair we had no problems with the staff, and found reception staff very obliging. We had a buffet breakfast incuded with our stay and this was adequate for us. In conclusion I would not recommend this hotel and certainly dont think that it up to 4* standard. Its only redeeming feature is its location which is handy for the metro and bus service.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel; Great location for Colosseo”
Reviews.Author: Vitz6
Reviews.Content: Good standard hotel. Not too hard to get to from Ciampino Airport using easy to follow Metro. Fantastic view when climbing the steps from the metro station - first thing you see is the Colosseo!! About a 10 min walk to the hotel from the metro. About a 20 min walk to the town centre (Trevi Fountain etc); 5 min metro ride to Vatican City. Room was average size and well maintained. Breakfast is standard stuff. Staff are approachable and helpful. Not spectacular but not a dive either.

Reviews.Title: “Not good enough.”
Reviews.Author: PickySeeksNotPicky
Reviews.Content: This hotel should not qualify as four stars. Our room was small and dirty. Nothing like the photos. There was a giant pillar in the middle which made it seem even smaller. The Hotel Services brochure said that there would be a buffet breakfast, and a complimentary breakfast could be delivered to the room. The buffet? 3 croissants. The cost of the buffet? 6euro. The cost of the complimentary breakfast-in-room? 15euro. I asked about this at the front desk. The man informed me that complimentary means 'at extra cost' and that I should consult a dictionary. Really? As a native speaker, I thought my command of the English language was pretty good! He backtracked and said that I hadn't paid a high enough rate to be a respected guest. My bad! I didn't see the "Be a respected guest" option on the booking form. Our bed was never tidied by housekeeping. Any reccommendations for places to eat were places the Hotel had side-deals with, but I think this is standard. In summary, this hotel offers nothing other than location and attitude. Location was good though.

Reviews.Title: “good enough”
Reviews.Author: atravelam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 days - Sept. 11-12. We had just flown in from the US, arrived mid morning, and were happy to find that a room was available for us. It was on the 6th floor with a nice view of the Colosseum. The room was a bit worn and small - but clean and nice enough. It was hot while we were there and it was nice to have the air-conditioning, even though it barely seemed to work at times. Our room was very quiet and the bed was comfortable, bathroom small but ok. One of the nice things about the hotel was the rooftop pool and bar area. My husband used the pool twice in the late afternoon to cool off from our busy days of sightseeing. It was almost empty at this time. We enjoyed drinks outside at the rooftop bar area. Diego was the barman and we had excellent service. He even recommended a place to eat that was nearby and it was excellent - can't remember the name - but ask him - he will know. We also had the 6 euro breakfast each morning - juice,pastry,coffee - this is located on the rooftop (weather permitting) which is a lovely way to start the day - eating a pastry, sipping on a delicious cappuccino, looking out at the Colosseum. It is a great place to stay if you want to be close to the Colosseum, Roman Forum, Palentine Hill, etc. It is an easy walk to the metro that will get you to the Vatican, Spanish steps, etc. It is about a 25 -30 minute walk to Piazza Novona - we walked this on a very rainy night and it was ok - but the metro is so easy. The staff at the front desk were very helpful to us. We were only there for 2 days and it was fine for what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location not 4 stars though”
Reviews.Author: Eur0pe08
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was great with stunning views of the Colosseum from the pool! . However the hotel is very old and needs a make over badly! The room size was good and had everything that you needed it just wasnt 4 star value though. I didnt eat or drink at the hotel because the prices were very expensive so i cant comment on that. If you want a fairly central location then this is a good hotel its about a 10 min walk to the station or you can walk to most of the sites if your up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Once again pleased with the hotel Delta”
Reviews.Author: garymac_uk
Reviews.Content: We had booked this hotel for two visits a week apart with a stay in Sorrento in the middle. On our first arrival we arrived the hotel at 1140 on a hot (96 degrees) Wednesday in July and, despite being early, after a bit of searching, a room was found for us. We had a 3 bed room, one double and a single, which was spacious and clean although a bit of an unusual shape. We took advantage of the 6 euro buffet breakfast in the “bar Gladiotore” which whilst the food was ok, the girl serving did not appear to be on the ball and did not seem to realise that she needed to order more supplies from the kitchen to replenish what other guests had consumed. We used the pool on the roof which is small but still an ideal way to refresh yourself after a day slogging the tourist trail. There were however too few sunbeds for guests to use. While there was an attendant, he seemed quite happy to allow an unattended girl of about 7 or 8 to swim. I personally feel that although the pool was attended that there should have been parental or other adult supervision and that the attendant wasn't doing his job properly allowing this. All these minor shortcomings I have brought up in my customer satisfaction e-mail to Accor Hotels. The hotel as stated in other reviews is about 200 metres from the Colosseum and an easy walk to the place Venezia and Via del Corso. A bus and tram stop is right outside and Romes cheap public transport (1 euro for 75 mins travel) took us where we wanted to go. Remember to make sure you have a ticket before you board as not all transport has a ticket issuing machine. The city was very expensive and many of the prices in restaurants and shops were very dear, to the extent that it looked like they were just trying to work out what was the maximum they could charge and still get business. Some shops were charging 100% more for the same item. Overall the hotel suited my needs well and if I were to return to Rome(I threw a coin in the Trevi) it would be amongst the first few I would investigate.

Reviews.Title: “A Must if you want a pool at a good rate in the centre”
Reviews.Author: Bear-7
Reviews.Content: I had booked a three day trip to Rome and up until the day before our trip I had booked a different hotel, then I realised that the temperature was going to be very hot so opted to look for a hotel with a pool. This is difficult considering half of the hotels in the centre of with pools are v expensive, however I found the Mercure Delta at a ok rate so opted for that. The location is fantastic, close to the metro and great bus links directly outside which we took daily to get to the other sites - also a few minutes away from the colosseum which is just fantastic. The hotel itself is billed as a 4 star but like many other reviewers said it is more of a 3 star, our room was very clean but we didnt have a view and the bathroom was a good size but again like other reviewers have mentioned the shower was small. The highlight was of course the pool, which on the roof top of the building over looks the colosseum and was completely worth changing hotels for. The temperatures rose to 35 degrees so it was a perfect tonic when we had sweated it out around the sites during the day, also on the roof top was a bar, which was great, although the service was a little slow but it was a relaxing enviornment so nothing bothered you too much. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel, dont go expecting a luxury hotel, its not. But it has everything you need to rest your head and if the weather is hot you couldnt ask for more than the roof-top pool. They even have shower rooms by the pool so we checked out but were able to use the pool for the rest of the day until our flight and have a shower and get changed which was a bonus. If you arent going to use the pool then there are probably better qulaity hotels available in Rome but for what we needed it for it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Barely a 3 star hotel..............”
Reviews.Author: sweaterman
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it was the only reasonably priced hotel with a pool in Rome. The pool and location (close to Colloseum) are this hotel's only redeeming features. 1. Service is lack lustre and rude. Staff seem to think they are the ones on holiday; work appears to be something which gets in the way of their down time. 2. Ground floor bar is never open 3. Roof top bar closes when they feel like it and not at designated midnight, which in itself is far too early for a four star resident's bar 4. Dirty, tired small room, and mine was 'superior'. 5. English speakers designated by their badge do not speak english to a high enough standard 6. Too few sun loungers in pool area resulting in people camped out on floor/chairs. There is no way this hotel should be rated four stars it is only just a three star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for your money”
Reviews.Author: el_roquero
Reviews.Content: If you read reviews for reasoanbly-priced hotels in the historic part of Rome, you will find that 90 % of complaints are about the size of rooms being too small. This hotel is no exception and it is certainly no luxury hotel either. However, just being able to see the Coloseum as you exit your hotel (and from the window of some of the rooms) is a delight. The room was small, but clean. There was no Internet access, only instructions on how to use a dial-up access, which didn't seem to work in my case. I was too busy sight-seeing anyway to check email. Breakfast at the hotel (not included, at least for the deal I got) was decent: the marmalde croissants are great, but the waiteress took ages to bring my coffee. I was annoyed becasued I had very limited in Rome and I wanted to spend every minute of it sight-seeing, but I supposed people may not like to be rushed by the waiteress. The hotel is located within easy walking distance from the Coloseo Metro station, which makes it easy to get around, e.g to the Termini train station and to St. Peter's Basilica. This statment is valid as long as you don't plan to carry heavy luggage on the Metro, because as far as I could see there were no elevators or escalators in the metro stations and lots of stairs are involved. There are a number of restaurants nearby. Most are very tourist-oriented, but the best one I found was at the corner of Via Annia and Via Claudia. I forgot its name, but there is only one there. Rome is a very compact city. You can walk from the hotel to the Colosseum in 5 min, to Palatino and Roman Forum in 10-15 min. The walk from the hotel to Piazza da Venezia is about 20 minutes. I actually walked from the hotel to the Pantheon and from there to San Peter's (and took the metro back from there), although I don't recommend that walk for you if you are not used to walking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: nk2008
Reviews.Content: I gave it an above average rating due to its location. The hotel is located about 400m from the Colesseum and the Colesseo Metro. Although rooms were fairly old they were clean and of reasonable size. Good about the hotel is that its has bus stops right in front of the hotel and you can hop on to the bus to all great attractions. I basically used bus numbers 85, 517,87 to get a round. With the Roma Pass, you get a 3 day travelcard on the metro and bus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Churchill69
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a 40th birthday present for my partner who was very keen to see the colossum. This was the perfect hotel. About 500 yards left from the Metro which is right in front of the Colosseum. I booked with venere and paid £400 for 3 nights. I emailed the hotel proir to my arrival and requested a room with a view of the Colosseum and was given room 738. The room had everything we needed. Air con, mini bar, complimentry water and was cleaned everyday.The bathroom was small but again had everything. (Ladies the hairdryer is very good). We didn't use the bar or restaurant facilities so cannot comment on them. We did however use the roof pool which was heaven after several hours of sight seeing. (This hotel must be 1 of the very few in the center of Rome with a pool.) It is a shallow pool with around 20 beds but has a fantastic view and is open till 8pm with piped music and a very pleasent pool attendant. This hotel is quite pricy but i feel well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Not really meeting our expectations”
Reviews.Author: farery
Reviews.Content: Rooms are really in bad shape. I guess they have not been refurbished since decades. Room has not been cleaned up by the maid. Features in the bath room were down and dirty, or even broken. On the positive side. Nice breakfast, nice pool area at the roof with a great view. But....definitely way too expensive (I paid 185 Euro for a double room, occupied with two persons). Overall this hotel is definitely in the range of 2-3 star hotel, not more. At their front door they claim to be a 4* Hotel. Well, they can keep on dreaming.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short break to Rome”
Reviews.Author: anna2303
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at this hotel. We were given a room with a view of the Colosseum, which I understand would normally cost extra. We booked directly through the Accor website and paid around £100 a night. The room was quite big, at least for Europe. There was a slightly random pillar in one part of the room but it didn't really get in the way. The room was clean and there was plenty of storage as well as an in-room safe. The bathroom was small but clean and perfectly adequate. My one gripe is that the bed was two singles pushed together - and each was a bit saggy, leading to an uncomfortable ridge in the middle. I found no evidence of the shabbiness mentioned in other reviews, but perhaps our room was newly decorated. The location cannot be beaten - we used the number 87 bus to get into the Centro Storico, which connected with various other buses. The Colosseum and Forums were only 5 minutes walk away. It's not to far to venture back into the centre of an evening for a meal. We had the continental breakfast in the bar on a few occasions - juice, pastries and excellent coffee for 6 euros each, which I thought was good value. We also had drinks in the bar several times and found the staff very pleasant and the drinks good value. The rooftop terrace was delightful and a lovely place to relax and read a book after a day pounding the streets of Rome. I imagine when the pool is open it's even better - swimming with the sun going down over the Colosseum anyone?! Other staff were similarly helpful, making restaurant reservations etc. There could be more leaflets etc available for tourists, but I think that most guests are probably business travellers. Overall we wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel for trips to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Annie006
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the end of May 2007. We loved this Hotel. Comfortable bed in the large and clean room (with minibar,air conditioning , 2 TVs and desk). Many restaurants in the surrounding area.Is very close to the Colosseo,Metro Station,Ruins and Palatino .Great Location!!! We hope to stay in this Hotel next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: GMSUK
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect, 2 minutes walk to the nearest Metro line, 2 stops from Termini Train/bus/metro station and 20 minutes Metro ride/45 minute walk to The Valican City. Staff were friendly and helpful and even offered us a slightly later check-out as our flight wasn't until the evening. Room was big but a little shabby, bit of mildew in the shower anda bleach mark on the carpet. Just booked for my parents to stay there next month to celebrate their 40th wedding anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sean_e78
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week on business. Best thing about hotel was size of room and location. Room was on the shabby side.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and thats it.”
Reviews.Author: coysh
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on business for two nights it is in a good location for exploring Rome which is a fantastic city. That is its one good point. I had the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in I could touch 3 walls at the same time. The bed was one step from the door and one step in to the bathroom which was tiny. I am not tall only 5 8 and the shower head was in my face. If you are tall you would have to go on your knees. The décor is very tired and drab I would imagine that it was last refurbished when it opened do not be fooled by the modern exterior. The room was very warm and there was no way of turning off the heating the air con as mentioned by others does not work. The only option is to open the window. The hotel is on a very busy road with a lot of trams going past. The door had signs that it had been broken into plus the it did not have a very strong lock or secondary devise to secure the door such as a chain I would not have given this hotel 4 stars. I paid 126 Euros so it is not good value for money. I have stayed in other hotels in Rome that have been better. I do get the feeling that as Rome is one of the world’s most popular tourist destinations they do not try very hard. They know they will have a very high occupancy rate what ever they do or offer. I will look elsewhere when I come back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest Staff -Theft from the luggage room and guest room”
Reviews.Author: UStraveler40
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Delta Colosseo in November 2007 as a Rome trip extension on our OAT tour of Tuscany. The stay was mostly unremarkable until our departure. We checked out by the noon checkout time and then left our (5) bags with the bellman to put in the hotel luggage room while we went to lunch before our ride to the airport. We we returned about 1 PM, the bellman was no where to be found. The blond woman at the front desk got the bags from the locked luggage room with my husband's help. When we arrived home in the U.S. we found that numerous items had been stolen from the two smallest bags, the carry-ons: eros, credit cards, and travelers checks. The thief was very selective about what he took to make it less likely that we would notice the theft until we arrived home. For example, when taking cash from my wallet he left 20 euro and some English pounds. Had we been going to England, we might have missed the pounds immediately. OAT (Overseas Adventure Travel) seemed to be looking into the theft, but then did nothing about it. They did not even report it, which we, being in the U.S. could not do. The maid had regularly helped herself to the chocolates we had brought from Belguim. Stay elsewhere and keep you peace of mind.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ousaems
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed in this hotel for a long week-end in November 2007. I had chosen it mainly becuase of its conveniente location and had got a good deal on the price. Good points: location, location, location. the colosseum, palatine and forum are, litereally, a 5 minute walk away and the center of rome with the trevi fountain, pantheon and the main shopping streets are also within easy walking distance. The staff were friendly and helpful and were quick to sort out any problems; we did not like the room we had been assigned on arrival as it was on a smoking floor (our mistake for not speicying non-smoking...) but they were happy to change it and even gave us a couple of alternatives. Breakfast was pretty much what you would expect at this level, buffet style with a reasonable choice, staff were helpful and, although there is a coffee / tea / hot milk machine, will make 'proper' coffee and capuccino on request and at no extra charge. Most staff seem to have an adequate English. Lastly, there is a roof terrace with a small pool, open during the summer months, a definate bonus after a long day of sight-seeing! Bad points: don't expect personality ........ this is mainly a business hotel, part of a large international chain, there were some tourists but most of the other guests seemed to be in rome on business. The decor is a little dreary, i'd say the hotel was last decorated in the 90's and needs to be brought up to date. Bathrooom appeared clean, but a little worn. However, on a visit to rome, you're not going to be spending much time in the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Spotless and excellent location, Dublin, Ireland”
Reviews.Author: ferkeen
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the end of Oct 2007. It's a 4* but should be a 3* as it's a bit shabby for a 4*. However, it was spotlessly clean, and the staff were very helpful and friendly, especially with regards to taxis, coming in late etc. The only downside was breakfast. The selection was good - plenty of hot food, but it had only machines for hot drinks, even the orange juice. However, there were plenty of cereals, yoghurt and pastries. It starts serving at 6.30am and this is clearly to accomodate the amount of people heading to the Colosseum v close by. Best to go down for breakfast about 7 or 8am, and not nearer to 10am when it stops. It is ideally located I have to say. You can walk into the city centre in no time and if I were to go again I would stay in this area. I might get a different hotel, but given that I would know what to expect this isn't a bad place to stay at all. Breakfast was the only glitch, but you make up for that by going for a coffee etc elsewhere. One review mentioned the noise. The windows were excellent at keeping the noise out once they were shut so I don't see this as a problem at all. And the beds were soooooo comfortable. So apart from breakfast and for a first-time stay in Rome, it's not a bad hotel at all. Though having said all this I wasn't paying and given what the prices were this is why I'm surprised at it's 4* status and the breakfast situation.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: alexs76
Reviews.Content: I'd had terrible experiences at other hotels in Rome so I arrived here with some trepidation. In fact this hotel was fine - the room was very small, but in reasonable condition and quite comfortable. Some parts of the hotel needed updating - for example, carpets in corridors were a bit worn out - and it's on quite a noisy street. The air conditionning in the room did not work so I had to have the window open and didn't sleep well. A good quality breakfast was included in the price. The location was good for tourists (near the Colosseum). Overall there's nothing great about this hotel but it was reasonably priced and better than anywhere else I've stayed in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Holiday”
Reviews.Author: buryletewke
Reviews.Content: We were a little unsure when we booked this hotel because some of the reviews weren't great. We couldnt disagree more. The rooms were great. Ours was spacious & clean, we had complimentary mineral water, 2 TVs with english news channels & a colloseum view at no extra cost. The staff were lovely, very helpful & spoke good english. The only minor issues we had with the hotel were that the bathroom was small, our safe kept going on the blink and the breakfast wasn't great (like all hotels ive stayed in abroad). The view from the rooftop pool & bar was amazing, however the pool was really cold (too cold to use) and there weren't many loungers to use & they were taken very quickly. The lifeguard moved our taowels also when we went to get some lunch which I didnt appreciate! Rome is amazing and you can walk to all the main attractions from this hotel as long as you dont mind walking for most of the day. However, there are lots of tour bus stops outside the hotel and the metro close to the hotel if you dont like walking We went to lots of restaurants in the surrounding area & they were all reasonably priced & very nice. (dont go to the Piazza Navona for a meal - 18 Euros for a pint of lager is just taking advantage of the tourists!). Nowhere has english football on so if you are an avid football fan, dont go when there is an international match on because you will miss it (as we did!) For all animal lovers, go to Torre Argentina (you will find it on the map the hotel reception will give you on arrival). This is where one of the 4 roman cat sancturarys are based & is within the ruins. You can look around, interact with the cats & chat with the volunteers (who do such a brlliant job!). They do not receive any governent funding & rely solely on donations & gift shop purchases, so please pop in & give what you can. On the whole we had a brilliant time, I could go on all day about how lovely rome is! When you get off the plane & travel to the hotel try to ignore the huge amount of grafitti on buildings etc, its not that bad in the centre (however, it's still bad, its such a shame!). Visit the Trevi Fountain, its breathtaking! Hold on to your bags though, its packed with tourists, illegal traders & pick pockets! To transfer to & from the airport , do not use the Terravision coaches, they are more expensive than the others & ours broke down on its way to collect us & the employee didnt relay this to the passengers waiting & made us late booking in for our flight home. (we also had to pay again for another shuttle & will try to claim back the cost from Terravision) They weren't very organised & didnt seem to care that they had made people almost miss their flights!

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: alanbDublin
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! great staff! great location. What more can you say. I can't find one bad thing to say about the hotel. The only thing i can knock the hotel for is the room size which is on the small size and the enclosed balcony made of glass which is a bit weird when you first walk out onto the balcony. but otherwise great, i'd go back anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: vjrBirmingham
Reviews.Content: Location couldn't be faulted. Staff at hotel were very friendly. Our only complaints were: 1. The swimming pool was freezing cold. We chose the hotel thinking that after a day full of sightseeing we could come back and relax by the pool but the temperature of the pool was just far too cold. I'm a regular swimmer so cold water normally doesn't bother me but this really was the exception ( the pool water was amazingly clear and may of been fresh water which hadn't had chance to warm up). 2. The hotel restuarant is only open for breakfast and the snacks menu is pretty bland, however there are fantastic little bar/resturants about 100 yards away. Don't believe the reviews about avoiding eating around the Colesseum. We enjoyed many meals around this area and avoided the City crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic setting, fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: nwukcop
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the other reviews of this hotel, we were a little dubious of our choice. However, the hotel was excellent, the stff very helpful and friendly, and the setting is stunning! The room was pretty much standard for he Accor chain, but had a superb view of the Colosseum - there was a sign at reception stating that rooms with Colosseum views cost extra - this was not the case for our room! Breakfasts were the usual bland fare, but there was plenty of good strong coffee available! Finally, the ABSOLUTE best part of this hotel was the rooftop bar and pool - fantastic views over the Colosseum area, and watching the sunset over Rome with a cold glass of beer was sublime! Highly recommended!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Does not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: artic54
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Mercure delta Colosseo and found that it was not as high quality as we expected given the price all the more so as we could not enjoy the rooftop swimming pool because of bad wheather. However it did not rain even the bar was closed and we could not access the top floor even to enjoy the view on the colosseo. Moreover, it seems that the room and the breakfast restaurant have not been redesigned since a few years and look quite poor. Regarding the breakfast menu, we were quite disppointed as we are very used to stay in Accor hotels (Sofitel, Mercure, ...) all over europe and found out that it was really not worth the price this time: coffee machine, no fresh fruits, bread seemed from yesterday, poor choice hot and cold beverages, ... Finally, we were lucky enough to get a room with a direct view on the colosseo but as strange as it may be we had to share the balcony with the people sleeping in the room next door.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: npr1uk
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is absolutely perfect. It is 5 minutes away from the Collosseum and Forum. There is also a metro station at the Collosseum which means easy access into the centre of Rome. The hotel itself was very clean and the staff very friendly. They offered restaurant recomendations and advixce on how to get about. Although the shower was small, the rooms were well appointed and air conditioned. There is a tv with international news channels, a fridge with complimentary bottles of water. At breakfast there was a buffet of hot items including bacon, eggs and also pastries, hams, cheeses, cereals. Ask the staff to make a cappucino rartgher than relying on the machine. The bar was expensive - 12 euros for a smal beer and a martini and lemonade. Don't rely on a lot of the reviews on here. The hotel was very good and I never tired of walking out of the front door and seeing the Collosseum just down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Hotel...Sweet Location”
Reviews.Author: Travellingranny
Reviews.Content: From March25 through April1, I stayed at the Delta Colosseo. I found the staff to be very friendly and extremely accommodating when possible. Honestly, after reading a few of the reviews here. I was a bit nervous, but my anxiety was swiftly put to rest upon arrival to the hotel. My room, although very small by US standards, was quite clean and comfortable, and I do have to admit that the shower was a tight squeeze (I believe it may have been placed as an afterthought during the hotel's renovation). The breakfast buffet was quite adequate, even for the heartiest of appetites, and included a variety of breads, pasteries, cereals, fruits and eggs, meats and cheeses...all very fresh. The location was on a wider, and busy street, but having lived in the city, I was not bothered by the noise when I opened my window to sleep at night.The Colosseum and Metro train are less than a five minute walk, and there are a number of shops and services in the neighborhood.. True, room service does not rank up there in score, but there are so many places outside the door, including both restaraunts and small grocers, the only time I used it was for my morning coffee. All of that being said, I would not hesitate to stay here again, and am looking forward to another visit within the next year.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: cuorum
Reviews.Content: I stayed just for one night in this hotel, thanks God! I was on a business trip and arrive late at night. They said there was, but there wasn't room service, as I had to go down to the bar, ask there for the menu (the choice was a slice of precooked pizza or a precooked sandwich), and go back to my room, wich was tiny, with a column in the middle, just in front of the TV. They hardly speak any other language than Italian, though most of the staff were nice. In fact I am so dissapointed because this is not even a one star hotel, and we paid for much more than that, actually they claim to be a four star hotel?!

Reviews.Title: “Love the location, Hate the shower”
Reviews.Author: Italian4cricket
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only a 2 or 3 minute walk from the colosseum and some rooms have a view of it. Not alot of shopping nearby, but there are some little cafes with great food in the nearby blocks. Most of the hotel employees speak english well and are very helpful. The rooms are small overall, some smaller than others. It seemed like the rooms on the corners of the hotel were larger and they had a tub and a shower in the bathroom (even though the tubs were very small). Our room only had a shower stall which was tiny, a larger person would not fit in it comfortably (smaller people don't even fit in it comfortably). We couldn't get the heat turned off completely or the air turned on in our room. Other guests also complained about how hot and uncomfortable their room was. We had to sleep with the windows open which made it very comfortable for us. Unfortunately there are no screens on the windows and the streets are EXTREMELY noisy all night long (the noise stops breifly around 5am only to start about an hour or 2 later). There is a rooftop patio that offers outstanding views of the city (great for taking pictures). There is also a pool and a bar on the patio, but they are closed for the winter months. Many attractions are within walking distance, but there is a bus stop across the street and the metro is just down the street across from the colosseum. The front desk will also call a cab for you, but some of the other guests advised that their cabbies "took them for a ride" or "took the scenic route", however the three times that we took a taxi we never had a problem. The hotel and the park beside the hotel were actually built on top of the site of Emperor Nero's golden palace. If you go into the hotels garage there are walls and walkways from the palace still there behind plexi-glass. Hotel employees told us that it is believed to be the basement of the palace that we can currently see in hte hotel garage. There is also a statue of the Emperor Augustus in the lobby that is an exact replica of a statue that was found in the basement of the palace/hotel during excavation. All in all, we enjoyed our stay. The service was good and the hotel and rooms were clean. They offer a complimentary breakfast that you can enjoy in the breakfast room, or have sent to your room if you fill out a form the night before. They also have laundry service available (which is helpful because you wont find a laundomat). We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good position, tiny room”
Reviews.Author: Fivefoot4
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great position close to the colosseum but the room I had (a single) was the smallest I encountered in my trip around Italy and in fact it was even smaller than the 1 star hotel I once stayed in in New York. I was there for 4 nights so it did matter more than if I had been only staying overnight. The shower was more like a step in broom closet. If you drop the soap you have to step out and pick it up and step back in. Washing my hair was difficult. The sullen Manager who didnt believe that the aircon wasnt working and his inference that it must be me my fault somehow even though I reported it twice and no one even checked it and the fact he didnt want to help me out with change of some notes or directions to the nearest supermarket added to my overall disatisfaction with the hotel. I must say the other staff though I encountered were polite and tried to be helpful. The location was great but I wouldnt stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “3 Star- Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Hellenv
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is good. Its a couple of blocks from the Colosseum, and from there you can get the Metro. If you arrive at the sametime w/ a tour, good luck!. It might have been that they were just so busy that they gave me a key to someone's room, but we worked things out. The rooms are small, and have tha "old" feel, and the smell of cigarrets is present.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great!”
Reviews.Author: TeresaHutchy
Reviews.Content: My mother and 2 sisters stayed a week, we had 2 rooms, we were in the right side of the hotel in the front corner second floor room, it was small, 2 small single beds pushed together, but it was clean and they came and serviced it each day. there was a big pillar in the corner, middle of the room, 1 foot in diameter, shower was small but good hot water, food was good, the pastries were wonderful, the eggs were a little weird, lots of weird meat. The left side 2nd floor room was my moms and was the same except she got a view of the colloseum out her window. we asked for adjoining rooms but the most they had was across the hall from each other. overall, given everything I would stay there again because its price was reasona ble but if iwere to go and money was no object I would pick a more luxurios Hotel. Capri was the best, florence shopping was good, good leather but expensive, all tours were great but wear good I mean good shoes, and get in shape before you go or you will have swollen ankles like we did..... Teresa

Reviews.Title: “Superb value...”
Reviews.Author: ChrisNY1
Reviews.Content: Set your expectations and you won't be disappointed. This is a terrific hotel for the price, in one of the best locations in the city. Minutes from the Coliseum, I visited there every day, such a wonderful place with so much activity. There is also a Metro station there, one change at Termini and you are at the Vatican. It couldn't be easier. Small? Yes - the room is small. But so are most hotel rooms (and living quarters!!) in Europe. No wonder most of them are outside in cafes and piazzas. You should be, too. You aren't travelling to Rome to spend time in your hotel room. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable, hairdryer (one of those attached to the wall) and safe, as well as mini bar. The gentlemen at the front desk were quite helpful with all of my questions. Only thing I would ask for is better air conditioning. I'd certainly use this hotel again, but if you are looking for a luxurious experience, with bellmen, and a concierge, you might look elsewhere.
